Ne fonctionne pas

Two days ago, I have been trying to log into my account, but every time I get a message saying that the phone number is wrong or the verification code is wrong, I think there is a big problem with this version
Unfortunately it‚Äôs not serving my location, Armenia

Finally a travel wallet with full Apple Pay integration - add funds immediately via Apple Pay, spend via Apple Watch or iPhone and not have to a carry a physical card. Competitive exchange rates too and this is looking like a great product, especially compared to my old travel wallet which took 2 business days to load money, no Apple integration and uncompetitive exchange rates just for the sake of frequent flyer points which I can earn elsewhere. Thanks Revolut, so far you‚Äôre living up to your name!

Great idea this card. It works well at most atms (cashpoints) I tried in Croatia and Italy on recent holidays but not all of them. The same at retailers. Just didn‚Äôt work at some of them. The app is easy to use.
However I did have a big problem which I haven‚Äôt been able to get a good answer from service. All my funds were withdrawn from cash points somewhere in Indonesia in three different transactions after my holiday and I have never even been there and I still have my Revolut card on me. And I have never shared my pin with anyone. I am at a loss how this can happen. It took me a long time to get Revolut to refund me the money stolen out of my account. The service made me feel like I was at fault for giving out my pin which I would never do. 

So there are issues here and I will hope they do improve as they grow. Service should focus on the customer and what their customers feel in the event of problems. Hopefully you won‚Äôt have any but if you do the measure of a good company is how well and how quickly they correct any problems.

Some how my sign up got corrupted when attempting to sign up.  While I tried months ago to sign up - the app crashed. I‚Äôve tried numerous times to complete the sign up but can‚Äôt get past entering my phone number and getting the annoying message ‚Äú Something has gone wrong, please try later‚Äù   On retrying Revolut says I‚Äôm already a customer because they have my phone number / but they don‚Äôt have my customer details. There is no easy way to contact them to resolve the issue.  It shouldn‚Äôt be this hard. While Revolut may be improving the way we do business it is not great at customer service or to resolve a simple customer sign up issue.  I think the founders and executives need to realize that their app creates lots of usability issues when a simple sign up can not be completed due to their app capturing corrupted data through a previous app crash.  Simple issues like this need to resolved if Revolut is to be considered a serious long term player in FINTECH.  It‚Äôs a case of the developers not realizing that customer service must be integrated into the app to provide a successful product. Unfortunately this is a fail for me based on my experience.

So basically I waited on the list like a lot of you and I‚Äôve been on the list since September last year. But due to needing to change my number and getting a new phone I lost my previous account. Then today I finally got the email saying my account is ready to be opened finally cool I still have access to the email I used... did the support chat. Spent 3 hours on the chat *gross* just to get my account back verifying all my details got it all correct then they tell me after 3 hours of waiting that I have to wait on my new account even longer because the person had deleted my account during the chat when I didn‚Äôt want that! I wanted my account back with my new number. This is just a horrible experience. Thank you revolut for being like the rest of the banks... banks don‚Äôt keep up in time you say but I say you went back in time with a fresh coat of paint and pretty bank cards.

I have now been using Revolut for a couple of months both in my home country (Switzerland) and elsewhere. The experience is lightyears ahead of the various credit/debit cards. Instant confirmation. Clever smartphone and Apple watch integrations. Superb user interface and very good exchange rates. Have recommended Revolut to many friends and their feedback has been even more enthusiastic. Highly recommended.

I tried to change my old uk address to an Australian address but was told through app chat that I can‚Äôt do that. They said close uk account and open Aus account. So I closed uk account - no issues. I went to open new Aus account but the app thinks I have an account and asks for mobile number, and when I enter the number is correctly says there is no account, but there is no ‚Äòcreate a new account‚Äô option! Your support service is all through in-app chat so how am I supposed to talk to you for support when I can‚Äôt get into the app. Unless someone responds to this review with help I have no other way to contact Revolut support!

Thanks for a great app!

I must question the need for constant layout changes and dramatic updates though. As soon as I‚Äôm used to one layout and method of accessing different features, there will be an update and everything changes again with completely different menus, sub-menus and locations of features.

I do understand that you want to provide the best app possible with the best ease-of-use. But please, at least stick to one general idea of an app layout. It‚Äôs hard to keep up.

I can‚Äôt find the list of my previously entered auto exchanges and price alerts anymore. It used to be under Rates. Now I can‚Äôt even find that. Can you tell me the way of getting to it now please?

I signed up to Revolut as my friend recommended it to me. It requires you to first load minimum 100SEK then verify your identity. I was given three ID options all of which are Swedish local IDs. As a traveller from the other side of the world I was unable to provide any documents and contacted them on the Live Chat to ask for a refund as I cannot access Revolut at all and had no idea this was the case. I waited more than an hour and a half with no response on the Live Chat. This is poor practice and I wonder how many other people are stuck in my situation. I highly recommend N26 instead, far superior in every aspect.

Instead of my order I have received garbage items in a parcel from China. There was no invoice, no confirmation email from the seller. It was not possible to send order back, there was no way of contacting the seller. Nothing.

I‚Äôm obsessed with this app, can‚Äôt stop using it! I haven‚Äôt picked up my wallet ever since I‚Äôve joined Revolut!
I‚Äôve always struggled at money management, but now I do it effortlessly, and I have fun while doing it. Revolut allows me to easily see where all my money went, and to refocus my budget on things that matter. The monthly budget and estimates features really help you finally stick to those financial goals you‚Äôve been trying to set your whole life!
The vault is also a genius feature, especially if you‚Äôre saving money with someone who can‚Äôt control their spending. Once you set up a vault with someone else, you‚Äôre the only one allowed to withdraw from it. And saving, here, also comes without you having to worry about it. Just activate the spare change feature, and you‚Äôll easily save up to 5% of your income without even noticing it!
Finally, in the age of shared subscriptions and digital services, Revolut makes it easier than ever to split costs. All you have to do is select how many people you‚Äôre splitting it with, and it sends precise requests to all parties involved ‚Äî every time they open their app, they‚Äôll be reminded of how much they owe you. Brilliant!

Incredibly convenient service, I highly recommend it to everyone who wants to avoid bank fees! Here are a few suggestions to make the app even better:
‚Ä¢ When adding a bank account to use for regular transfers, please add the ability to also save the reference text alongside the bank details. This will be useful since many companies use the information in the refence to identify the account holder. Currently, it has to be entered manually on every transfer, which is both inconvenient and prone to errors.
‚Ä¢ Please add the ability to have a local BGN account so that we don‚Äôt have to pay for SWIFT transfers. This would let me competely ditch my current bank and receive my monthly salary in Revolut. I may even pay for a Premium subscription:)
‚Ä¢ It is great that you are constantly working on improving the user experience of the app. However I find it a bit frustrating that the UI changes in a major way almost every month, especially after I had already gotten used to the previous design. Since Revolut is a banking app, I think that the customers should feel comfortable using it, be familiar with all the nooks and crannies, and not have to constantly rediscover where everything is.

I can't believe how unfriendly the new version is! 
Front screen: Very few information visible. I don't need to see the "Junior" section all the time. Great that you have that but really unnecessary for ppl without kids. For the moment I see only 1 piece of information - my latest transaction from 1 currency. Why did you remove the vaults from the drop-down menu of the currencies? Now you have two buttons (Add money & Send) and then half of empty screen - there is more than enough space to bring out the rest of the menus, like "Exchange" which was visible before. And also, I need to press on the three dots, and then press on Details? Not user-friendly.
Wealth tab: I see you designated the second tab to investors, which would mean that most of yours customers are investors. Maybe it would be good to have one layout for investors and another layout for "common people" like me - who are not going to buy crypto, we just want a good bank. 
Dashboard: Why did you have to change that and remove so many functionalities?? Bring back the vault and accounts "at one glance".
Overall: make the app more customizable. I'd like to be able to see information I need in one place, not browse three tabs.

Had high hopes, and boy, did they get crushed. Crypto trading is a joke. Huge premium on buying and selling, but here's the kicker: you get no access to your crypto. Yes, you pay a premium for it but when you try to take it and sell it for its market price, they tell you "sorry, you are only allowed to sell it to us at a loss". Let me repeat: the crypto you buy on Revolut is not yours. They hold it and will not give it to you. Sending and receiving money to other Revolut accounts only works half the time with a huge hassle, phone numbers and what not. Money ended up in the wrong account more than once. Account gets frozen over and over for no reason, no access to my money until i jump through hoops. It's a disaster. Everything is a pain with this app, even leaving a bad review makes my iphone glitch, this is the 5th time I try.

I‚Äôve been trying to create my account for a whole week and I‚Äôve had a lot of problems... I don‚Äôt have it yet, and I don‚Äôt really know if I actually will get it... the app is a nightmare. At least my experience.

Excellent exchange rates and zero ATM fees! I use this card mostly for internet shopping or when traveling abroad.  I love that you can set the limit and manually freeze the card and control wireless function on card. And standard package will cover all needs of normal internet shopper. In very few occasions card was actually rejected due to issues on Revolut side, but not more often than with my usual bank card. My card was scammed once, but in-built security worked and rejected the transaction. I have been recommending Revolut to all my colleagues.

First, Revolut is requiring private information in process of registration. One of the question was if I am connected to person XY? That was very scary because I realy know this person! Where and how did they find this personal information? I just hope they did not hack my contacts. And why do they need such private information? I am very sensitive about revealing personal information so I requested what information do they have about me (GDPR). The answer was obvious lie ‚Äì they said they only have my e-mail and phone number, not mentioning my contacts they obviously know. After that my account was blocked.

This leads to second issue. When trying to unblock my account I found that their customer support is bad. Robot is answering your questions, often with irrelevant answers. Several times I get in contact with human operators and all of them gave me the same generic answer that they need to review my case. After remainding them for 4 weeks, answer finaly came that I can not have Revolut account. Not one word of explanation, nothing. And no possibility to chat with them anymore.

But for the end avesome work :)

Very bad customer service in case you are a real customer, loss of trust. I have been requested to prove source of income after using the service for six months and switching to paid premium service by paying an annual fee in advance. Which is fine, after all, we are dealing with money. However, after providing official copy of my tax return within an hour, receipt of which was acknowledged, a week later Revolut blocked my account without any queries or further data request. During this week they happily accepted funds from me. Oh, and there is no direct way to discuss this issue with them. 

Unacceptable from a service claiming to be ‚ÄúFast, Secure and Radically Better‚Äù. They say no rubbish rates. This is plain rubbish. I am deeply disappointed. How can I trust these guys?

Negatives: 

1. really unreliable service when it comes to the use of the physical card transactions. Cash withdrawal and paypass payments are often failing while the amount gets locked on your Revolut balance for a while.
2. My local bank converts currencies on a relevantly better rate with card transactions (lol, but seriously K&H Bank Hungary).
3. Really aggressive marketing policy which isn‚Äôt sympathetic for me.

Positives: 
1. When they locked the money (which is already mine....) I got it back relatively soon, but I had to contact the customer service every time to do so.
2. Real time support is pretty good when it comes to get back your belongings, so I write this as a positive point.. 

All in all:
The only real function of this thing is that you can get about 200‚Ç¨ cash ‚Äúfreely‚Äù in the foreign country which you travel in (only if it works, but after these I wouldn‚Äôt rely on them solely) significantly cheaper than you would get it in an exchange office. 

For everything else, (eg. instant sending-receiving money) I would strongly recommend other companies like PayPal.. much much much more reliable.

I signed up for Revolut given its marketed ease of multi-currency transactions for international travellers. I have a Premium account. So far, I have used the card in 2 countries outside UK and I am now frustrated enough with the card to warrant writing this review. The Revolut card is like your unreliable but fun cousin: when it works, you will be smiling all the way at how convenient it is, however, whether it will work or not is a suspense you live with every time you go to swipe your card. On several occasions I have had my card declined at very critical moments and this happens because they do not have tie ups with even the major banks in the countries where they supposedly function so the POS machines will not let the transactions through. Reaching out to customer care is an equally futile affair given the response one gets is: ‚Äúwe do not have control over the policies of the merchant bank and hence cannot do anything‚Äù. They also have the audacity to suggest that you should try convincing the merchant banks to accept the Revolut card (that is not my job Revolut!). So all in all, I have spent hours at various shops, etc trying to find alternative payment arrangements given, well...I made the mistake of signing up for a card which cannot do what it‚Äôs basic function is: let me access my funds when I need them.

Summarizing: Don‚Äôt hope to rely on this card, hang on to your ‚Äútraditional‚Äù bank cards. You can have this card as a side kick to try at various occasions and it may work sometimes and save you some transaction fees. Definitely not worth paying to get a premium account.

As an expat living in Europe, I send money monthly to family back home in Asia and revolut offered an international bank transfer feature for us.

In order to waive the transfer fee, I upgraded my subscription to premium. However, little did I know, there‚Äôs an ‚Äúunexpected fee‚Äù for sending money above particular amount. My transfer was incomplete and the fund refunded was ‚Ç¨38 less than the amount that I‚Äôve transferred due to a failed transfer processors that refused to complete the transaction as revolut is using third party and the reason it failed was because "security measures and restrictions". Then, I‚Äôm being suggested to try to make the transfer again with a smaller amount that might be accepted by the processor.

What‚Äôs funny was that I transferred a smaller amount of fund previously and it was fully refunded, but not this time.

I was never informed that transferring above a particular amount would incur extra fees. Had I known this, I would have scheduled my transfers accordingly.

Without being informed about the risks such as fee incurred by transferring fund more than the limit by the customer, customers may feel that they are being given an undue burden that should have been settled by revolut. I felt that this gap should be addressed properly before launching this feature and more people lose their money unnecessarily.

Revolut √® stata una vera delusione: pagamento effettuato per errore su Agoda a causa di un inganno del loro motore di ricerca. Avvertita immediatamente, Revolut non ha bloccato il pagamento. Nei 2 giorni successivi nei quali il pagamento poteva essere ancora bloccato, non hanno mosso un dito. Alla fine Revolut mi ha detto che il rimborso non potevo ottenerlo perch√© dipendeva da Agoda e non da loro..che presa in giro! 92 euro letteralmente rubate, vergogna Revolut! Altre banche tutelano i loro clienti, bloccando subito il pagamento con la carta..Revolut no. Se ne fotte dei propri clienti. Quasi dall‚Äôinizio sono entrato a far parte del Revolut. E all‚Äôinizio la app era semplice e funzionale. E in questo senso ogni aggiornamento dell‚Äôapplicazione ti scombussolano tutta interfaccia grafica. In questi giorni stanno anche cambiando condizioni economiche in aggiunta a qualche blocco anche sull‚Äôutilizzo della carta, credo che il servizio possa essere considerato SOLO come aggiuntivo mai primario. Years ago prior to travelling the world, we tried to organise a multi-currency account through one of the larger banks, to allow us to avoid currency fluctiinas and excessive conversion fees for each transaction. But to set this up from outside the UK was daunting, and we were stifled by red tape and hurdles at every turn.

Wind forward a few years, and Revolut does everything we need, with simplicity that is almost disconcerting! Opening the account was effortless, Loading up and transferring between currencies and countries is easy and fast, the fees are reasonable and fair, and the confidence of having access to your money anywhere in a local currency so reassuring. 

The one and only inconvenience is simply the tools they put in place to avoid misuse of your account online. And merely inconvenient, not a big problem. Better to have this than be scammed. 

Well done Revolut, keep disrupting the old system!

Also tying the Revolut to one mobile no. is cumbersome when you travel with different phones and may have also have a work
Phone. It is probably more secure than email but it has proven difficult for me at times to download the app on a new device either travelling or after moving between jobs (changing phone numbers)

I love Revolut and am a big advocate. It would be great to see changes relating to the above issues.

For the most part, the app worked fine for me until I ran into a problem. I had an issue with an international ATM withdrawal where my account was debited but no cash came out. It wasn‚Äôt a fortune but it wasn‚Äôt just 20 quid where I would be less worried. I went through the procedure that Revolut had for instances like that. Support said to give it time and that the other bank might reverse the transaction automatically. I submitted a chargeback form through the app once the transaction was listed as complete. I was then told after a day to wait again for a few days to see if rhe situation would correct itself by a member of the chargeback team. The agent never close my chat session and I am now unable to get further support from the app at all. I have no option to close that chat myself through the app. Not being able to reach a human at all despite paying for a premium plan is distressing. I could have a new problem and no one would be able to help me because phone support is fully automated and there is no other way to get help but through chat. I have reached out through Facebook and was told somebody would get back to me but hours after, I am still unable to do anything through the chat app. For an institution handling money, I cannot stress how important it is to let customers be able to reach a human. We are not in a perfect world and robots with prerecorded messages cannot solve problems that well at the moment. A couple of hundred quid may not be a lot for Revolut but it sure is a lot for me. Be wary.

The idea is genius. Seriously. It it was done in the right way, then it would be revolutionary. But it‚Äôs bugged. Sometimes in a horribly irritating and unaccaptable ways. The exchange rates are given in the app but there‚Äôs always a catch - if you do the exchange on Sunday, right after sunrise or when the cat just crossed your way, or Santa Clause brought you a toy car for Christmas then you pay a provision. It‚Äôs impossible to know when and how much you pay. They say it‚Äôs written in some obfuscated Rules document, but when I‚Äôm travelling and just want to pay for a thing, I‚ÄôM NOT INTO READING RULES AND REGULATIONS THAT HAVE DOZENS OF PAGES to see how much I actually pay. Things like that should be marked clearly when I plan a transaction so the users are not being cheated.

Additionally, they force me to change the orientation of my iPad when I fire up the app. It‚Äôs just stupid. It‚Äôs a tiny interface, it would fit just fine, but nope, you have to close your keyboard, flip your tablet to use it. Makes no sense.

Other then that, it does work. I had some transactions made with success, but now I‚Äôll think twice, even three times before I pull out my revolut card.

Developers - think about it.

Hi.
Your app is great and I really like to use it, but, by my opinion, it doesn't not have a very important feature: recurrent asset buying for a fixed money amount.
I would like to have an ability to buy EUR to my EUR saving vault daily for a $20 equivalent from my USD account (price and amount of EUR will vary daily). Now I can set a fixed EUR amount for daily buying or set a rate for auto buying but it is not the thing I would like to have.
Could you add an input window there I can set an amount of money to spent for buying asset in recurrent payments? I think this feature will be really useful for many of your clients.

Hey there Revolut team! You have done a lot of good work! It's great to see, that high street banks are not the only option for financial operations.

The first one should let the users to connect their account with another one to see overall spenindgs of family for instance. I‚Äôd be happy if I could use Revolut to analyse spendings together with my wife, but to be able to see them separately too.

Second one would be handy to add payments done by another credit card or by cash to our spendings report in Revolut. For now I don‚Äôt see such an option. I know that it‚Äôs better for you to make users to pay most of their spendings using Revolut card, but honestly sometimes there are situations you cannot pay by card or Revolut doesn‚Äôt apply.

So some off you are most likely thinking if it‚Äôs as good as you say then why haven‚Äôt you upgraded to the annual fee account the reason is that I don‚Äôt travel enough for it to be financially viable if I traveled a lot then yes Definitely would pay for the upgraded account plus brilliant App very well designed slick interface and very responsive works very well in real time money transfers as in moving money from my bank account to the Revolut Account so I don‚Äôt even have to take actual money with me as I can transfer money as and when I need it so this gets a ü§ôüëçü§ôüëç from me.üòÅ

I was using Revolut for the past 2+ years and was amazed by the idea, the freedom, the app, the support .. everything actually they did, I was think ‚Äúwow, these guys are beyond excellent!‚Äù... till today!!! after the last update I‚Äôve found out that the main currency was logged to be the one as per the country where I have given to Revolut my actual residential address! it was done without my consent in any form, and on top of that the virtual card I use was also switched from Euro to the local currency, also without asking me or providing me with a choice and worst - not possible to be switched back or somehow integrated to be possible that me myself may decide do I like it or not! the support was not helpful anyhow - they‚Äôve just repeated ‚Äúit is as it is... we can not change it... you too can not change it...‚Äù and on top of that ‚Äúprovide us with address in a country where the main currency is Euro‚Äù ?!?!? well I can not and will not provide any european address as this one I consider more european than any other at first and second - why don‚Äôt you simply let the customer know and then be able to decide is it ok for him the changes you‚Äôve done without his agreement ?!?!!?  long story short: Revolut lost me forever ...

I love the concept and the premium offering is good but the price you pay is frankly almost nonexistent customer service. I‚Äôve been locked out of the app and this supposedly while they certify my identity. I‚Äôve sent photos of my driving licence, passport, marriage certificate and work photo ID with my disclosure and barring service (UK police check for people who work with schools, hospitals etc) and that was two days ago. I have ¬£75k in funds but cannot access it. You cannot phone them or email them and no web access. In desperation I‚Äôm downloading the app again. If you are over 40 (as I am) or work and cannot gave your phone in your hand 24/7 forget customer service because you will never know when and at what time they‚Äôll respond. If you miss the response they ‚Äòcut off you chat window‚Äô and that‚Äôs it you have to start again. As I said at the start great idea when it goes well, but the frustration when it doesn‚Äôt is too frustrating to make it a reliable current account offering at least at this point in time. That had certainly been my experience and as a COO of a medium sized organisation I sympathise with them but it doesn‚Äôt reduce the frustration.

I joined Revolut in spite of the worrying things I had heard about them freezing accounts, I just thought they must have a good reason for it. But then I (almost) experienced the exact same thing. And no one replied to me for for more than two days. I had two payments for significant amounts pending during this time, which was incredibly stressful! They finally said that I couldn‚Äôt make any more payments to the account although I would be able to make payments out with the remaining balance. Fine. THEN two weeks later I get another message from them asking for the same documents that I‚Äôve already told them I don‚Äôt have! Cue another load of stress and panic that they will freeze my account. Their service in general is complete joke, it is not a replacement for real human contact, I‚Äôve now spoken to 5-6 people on their chat system and only once did I feel like I was talking to an actual person. (I‚Äôve still not had an answer as to why they contacted me again despite asking them four times in the chat) IF you are going to use Revolut, first take a look at their community pages and all the people who are stuck with a frozen account with no one responding to them! If you are still going to open an account anyway, please please realise that they are NOT a replacement for your regular bank, and please please don‚Äôt trust them with large amounts of money. Their service is not at all what they claim to offer.

A truly incredible and wonderful futuristic app is severely let down by a complete lack of customer service and support. It seems there are also frequent app outages although now sorted there was one today which didn‚Äôt allow me to trade stock which is alarming as prices continue to change. Be careful when using your card in the USA. The app does not update for all the amounts taken against your account and so ‚Äòtips‚Äô and service charges come off your balance days later, rather than just coming off as one entry all at the same time. Also, if you set up a tab using your Revolut card and then close out in cash, or the merchant accidentally swipes your card twice (oddity of the way cards are used in the USA), these ‚Äòholds‚Äô on your card mean you are effectively charged for these amounts as they show on your account as ‚Äòpending‚Äô charges. The merchants in the USA have no way to cancel these (believe me I‚Äôve tried asking) as they are not real charges, and they don‚Äôt have any way to see them. So you have to wait a week (7days) before they are reversed. You will not be able to access this money - yes YOUR money - during this time and once reversed, can take up to 30days to appear back in your account! Normal bank accounts do similar things, but still show your balance with and without these pending charges. As this is not a debit card though, Revolut can‚Äôt afford for you to potentially go overdrawn and so they only show your balance with these pending (yet never to be transacted) entries deducted from your balance. This is a major problem if you‚Äôre only using this card for overseas use or holidays and need this money for whilst your actually overseas!! Certainly taken a dent out of my holiday cash!

Let me first clarify that I was always the first to sing praises of Revolut. I even subscribed for their metal plan. However a couple of weeks ago they just locked me out of the app without ANY prior warning. I had no way of accessing my funds. Only the in-app chat was accessible with the message that I had to verify my identity. Turns out the problem was I accepted several 3$ payments from my friends that are not residents of UK. I was asked to explain the source of these funds by 5 different support agents. I explained and provided proofs each time. Every time the agent would take 4-5 hours to respond and then pass it on over to the next agent. And if I didn‚Äôt respond within 15 minutes they‚Äôd drop the chat. I provided all kinds of proof but they‚Äôd always come back with the same question. I said I want to close my account and transfer the existing funds to Monzo (which btw is a far superior experience to Revolut both in customer service and in banking) but they‚Äôd just never respond to that statement. Eventually they even kicked me out of the in-app chat. Like the option to request support via the app is not available to me anymore. So now I‚Äôm left with no way to access my legitimate 50¬£ or so and on top of it I can‚Äôt even contact Revolut lol. My only option now is to write this review with the hopes that you‚Äôll all read it and stay clear of this app.

My experience with Revolut started out really well, it seemed like a very user friendly bank especially tailored for younger people and visa holders due to its flexibility and ease of exchanging currencies. The app is good and still the best feature. 

However in the past 6 months I‚Äôve had my account frozen 2-3 times by Revolut for literally no reason, when this happens I try and access my accounts but I‚Äôm unable to nor can I speak with anyone as I have a message saying they are investigating my account for fraud and to come back in 72 hours. When I finally chat to their customer service, which is another really awful compromise of using Revolut, another story... they demand my historic payslips, passport, and explanation of who I‚Äôm transferring money to, which were small amounts to friends for things like restaurants. This happened on more than one occasion and most recently they are now saying they will freeze my account soon indefinitely if I don‚Äôt provide a UK driving license or residence permit. Of which due to covid I don‚Äôt have one up to date! They won‚Äôt listen to my circumstances and never have. 
An absolute nightmare of an experience all in all, thank god I had backup ways to pay my rent and food etc. It takes a lot for someone to switch banks and well Revolut has well and truly gone out of their way to make my experience as hard as possible.

I‚Äôm a customer since the early days. The user experience has always been fantastic but the app has become quite confusing over the last couple of updates. The new home screen is way off base and far from meeting my daily needs. My currency accounts have been relegated to a small section of the screen and packed away under clunky interactions. A chunk of the home screen real estate is now occupied by up-sell ads. I‚Äôve already paid for a premium account so would prefer if the up-sells got out of my wayü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. The key day to day account and transaction information is pretty much hidden. There are so many features at this point that the current app architecture is inconsistent and unintuitive. Just compare the differences between a Pound account and a Crypto account. They each share similar information and user actions but are formatted in completely different ways forcing me to switch gears in different account types. I find myself hunting for info and actions most days now. Key actions hidden off screen or currency rates and alerts buried in a widget rather than included in the currencies main page... It‚Äôs starting to feel messy. I hope the product team will improve the information structure. The homepage could really do with rolling back a few iterations.

I am a type one diabetic who lost my debit card and thought it would be great to use my Revolute card so transferred some money via a friend so I can use a card while I waited for a replacement and buy groceries etc. They held the money and then when I waited 4 hours I went to say ‚Äúsomething is wrong‚Äù to see a message from one of this employees (notice I didn‚Äôt get anything sent to me it was hidden in the app). 6 hours later no response and my money is held nowhere, no option to return it and no way of getting a response. I have read their response that as a financial provider they have to do due diligence, transfers to my own bank account are done instantly and my bank is also a financial institution, friends with Monzo do not have this issue and I am disappointed mainly that they ignore you. I believe they are making money while they hold your money and do not believe this due diligence excuse (if it were I would expect a response that use legislative explanation). This seems to be a strange financial institution, with low ethics. I will be taking my concerns to the FCA to find out why it takes days to put through a payment into an account and how they are treating their customers fairly by responding to REVIEWS but not to their customer service queries. I wouldn‚Äôt have written a review had I had a response to my query. AVOID THIS COMPANY.

Normally when you use a debit card to pay, nobody charges you. I have a business account debit card. I have used it over a year and nobody charged me for using it. But recently I used it to credit my Revolut account and they charged me about ¬£200. You will not realise this upfront because it does not show explicit in the Revolut application. You can only realise the robbery if you check your bank account. I got in touch with Revolut and they said it is because of your card type. But they will happily register your card without a warning. They will not explicitly ask for your confirmation during the transaction. I did get a small print that said cards outside EU are charged a small fee but because my account is in the UK and with Barclays, I thought it did not apply to me. And they did not say what they are charging in total. I thought in the end I was only paying the credit amount. But when I looked in my bank account I cried. Hundreds of pounds for a simple bank transfer! Revolut refused flat out to return the transaction. This is a complete and free process for them but they were happy to keep the robbery they had succeeded. I will peruse this with financial Ombudsman. It is a time consuming effort but someone has to do it to stop cowboys robbing people and making ordinary people scared of using online financial services.

DO NOT USE - Serious security breach from Revolut!!! i have been hacked and scammed. The scammers were able to send me a text off the Revolut text system, i simply cannot believe it. They have taken ¬£1060 from me. All i want to do is speak to someone from Revolut on the phone and be reassured but they don't have a customer services phone number and refuse to give me a call to discuss and will only speak through their app! I spent over 8 hours yesterday on the app live chatting with someone (4 hours of this time was spent waiting to be connected to a live agent from their specials fraud team and that's only after tweeting Revolut about it!!). I go on holiday on Friday and all my holiday spending money is now gone, I'm completely distraught. Your money is not safe with them! they said they will investigate and come back to me but are unable to give me any kind of time frame and assurance they will return my money. This service would not happen with a conventional bank, it would be dealt immediately and i'd be refunded so why should i expect any different from Revolut?? The longer they take to resolve this the longer the scammers haveto cover their tracks and the less chance i have of getting my money back - completely appalled. I recommended all my friends join Revolut and will be making sure that no one ever does in future!

It‚Äôs all too easy for the customer service team to reply to the reviews but when you actually want them to help you they‚Äôre never accessible. I was told to write ‚Äòlive agent‚Äô which I have done several times but it goes for hours without any response, as if I have all the time in the world just to sit and wait to get a gracious buzz and say wow what a great service! Always the same idiotic reply that ‚Äò‚Äòwe will be with you as soon as possible blah blah‚Äô‚Äô, and honestly it‚Äôs been times that I was off from work and actually dedicated time to wait for the so called customer service to hear me out but I have never managed to sort my problem. Just think that I have some money in my card from 2017 and can‚Äôt use it, is that not stealing? I even wrote a letter to them explaining the situation which was my card suddenly got blocked... no one got back to me and the silly online chat is always a virtual thing which will never be able to solve anything anyway. It‚Äôs the worst customer service ever and I say that with certainty as I‚Äôve been working in a bank for the past 12 years and honestly it‚Äôs just not possible if a bank can just take people‚Äôs money block their account, doesn‚Äôt reply to a hand written letter from customers and just write some friendly fake replies to negative reviews! Unimaginable and truly awful company.

This is an updated version of my review. I‚Äôm leaving the previous one below. I received an email saying that they fixed the issue and they have! I went for the premium version and I‚Äôve ordered
my cards, so now we wait. Until I get my cards and see if it works, I‚Äôll leave it at 3 stars. As I said on my previous review, the product looks very promising and I‚Äôm really looking forward to using it.

 I was thrilled when I found about Revolut. Unfortunately, now that I made it to the front to the queue and the time to start the process to get a card has come, the app crashes after the pin screen. My husband is having the same problem. Though he got past the identity verification phase but the same thing happens to him. He got in touch with customer support about 3 or 4 weeks ago, but they didn‚Äôt get in touch. So, we decided to try with my phone in case it was a problem with his model. We have 2 different iPhone models with the latest iOS. And yes, we tried turning it off and on again and reinstalling the app. Even if it suddenly started working, I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd be comfortable putting money on one of these cards if the app is so unreliable and customer service doesn‚Äôt reply. Unfortunate as the idea is fantastic.

The app is great, you can order a physical card for those places that don‚Äôt yet accept apple pay which is useful. Easy to use and very quick to set up an account, adding funds and switching funds between currencies is easy and quick from my experience. 

Only complaint I have (and I have this complaint with a lot of apps) is that the apple watch part of the app is not yet compatible with the new watch faces. Currently i‚Äôm using this to keep track of my available spending money for stuff that i haven‚Äôt budgeted for already and having the remaining balance for the week/month at a quick glance on my wrist is very useful, just a shame that i am restricted on which watch faces i can use. 

Other than that, very useful app, apple pay contactless works pretty much instantly, physical card came within a few days, standing orders can be created from your online banking directly to the account to make budgeting yourself easier, converting currencies is very simple and there are different features like trading and vaults ect.

I just want to say Revolut is fantastic. That being said I have to comment on your recent update of the Accounts tab. The trend line showing spending on each currency now occupies three quarters of the screen along with the list of transactions just below it and is not user friendly. 

It is not easy as it was before to navigate across currencies and also to top up because quite frankly there just isn‚Äôt space on the screen. I am finding myself accidental clicking on the trend line and then the top up button disappears and it is not intuitive to find it again. I‚Äôm finding It is redundant and unnecessary to have that trend line plus the list of transactions immediately below since you can get all that information anyway when you go to the Analytics tab. 

In my opinion and that of many of others that I encouraged to join and who made me join, revert back to old Accounts tab which was cleaner and less busy, and if anyone wants to know their top up trends and list of purchases they just go Analytics as it was before and you avoid cluttering.

I recently used revolut in a trip to europe. It was a good experience all in all right from the ease of opening the account, linking my bank account to revolut account , e-kyc, transferring money in the revolut account. The best of the feature is there seemless transfer of your balance between various currencies and at the actual market rates of the currencies without any markup or fees. I have not seen any other traditional bank offering this service Abe I definitely think this has helped me save money during my trip in currency conversion and fx mark up and service charges. I found the digital see debit sufficient for most of the purposes as most of the shopping you end up doing ,you can pay contactless in Europe but if you are travelling anywhere without that infrastructure extensively present then I think you would need there physical card. Only thing I wish from them is to improve the quality of the physical card they are offering. Otherwise no complaints and a regular user of the app now.

Yes, yes, yes to your questions .

Revolut have one major problem. They don‚Äôt have anybody that can think outside the box. Everyone in customer services just looks at the screen and reads what the screen says instead of applying any common sense to it. For example if you put ¬£200 in an account and sold and bought back currency 50 times revolute instantly think you must have an income of ¬£10,000. Then they want to know where you‚Äôve got their income from. They cannot believe that you just had only ¬£200.  So now they start to insist on seeing how are you got this ¬£10,000 spare cash. Which never existed in the first place. I can‚Äôt get you to prove that you had ¬£10,000 spare cash and the source of the funds even though you only actually had ¬£200 they start asking for your partners financial details and bank statements. When you try to speak to someone in customer service with a brain they just keep repeating at you but you must have ¬£10,000 spare cash. This has been going on for months and the account‚Äôs been blocked.. I would advise anyone to avoid them like the plague. They are just not able to do anything that involves common sense and you will probably either end up losing money or having your account blocked for several months because no one can see any common sense.

I opened a Revolut account to help me track and cub my spending. The app looked great for this. However hours after my first transaction I received a phishing text which I brought to the attention using the in app chat. They seemed to sort it but could really tell me what had happened so I didn‚Äôt feel very secure with them. The next day my account was locked and someone sent me a message saying they were ‚Äútaking over my case‚Äù and asked what information I had provided via the phishing scam (only my name and DOB). I responded with this and asked about my locked account and didn‚Äôt receive a message for two days, by which point I tweeted Revolut. I don‚Äôt like to do something so public but there is NO other way of contacting anyone for help and I couldn‚Äôt access anything in the app as it was locked along with my account. I got a response the next day saying they were ‚Äútaking over my case‚Äù and I asked again for a resolution as I needed access to my money. The next day my account is open again and no explanation of what the outcome of this case was provided. 

I have now moved all of my money and closed the account due to not feeling that my money is safe, and because of the extremely poor customer service.

I don‚Äôt usually write app reviews, but on this occasion it really needs to come out. It‚Äôs a shame that you guys managed to come up with such a good app and overall service just to let it all go down the drain because of the utter disrespect with which you treat your customers when it comes to customer service. 
If you really want to be a valid alternative to mainstream banks you should address asap all the problems in this area.
I understand you are required to do checks and KYC and other due diligence, but it is almost criminal to be unreachable and lock people‚Äôs money for days on without a way of flagging urgent matters.
This is the third time in as many months that a source of income is required of me (which will be the same as in the previous two occasions) and I cannot conduct my business because your chat services are not working and there is no other way I can get in touch to solve this.
I am really considering a formal complaint since I am paying for a ‚Äúpriority chat‚Äù service which clearly is a lie.

I‚Äôm amazed at how many useful services Revolut offers, im usually so reluctant to do open new accounts and things but all my friends use this and so I thought I should try it out. I am from the UK but studying in the Netherlands with a part time job there. I get paid into my Dutch account but have bills to pay still from my UK account however my income obviously doesn‚Äôt go there. I was struggling to find ways where I wasn‚Äôt going to lose massively on transaction fees from international bank transfers on top of the loss from exchange rate. Revolut offered the best rate as well as free and easy transfers between all of my accounts as a sort of middle man. I‚Äôm really buzzing about it actually! For once I feel like I am on top of my spending and can seamlessly shift between the two major currencies I operate with. For someone who frequently travels or lives/works between different countries this is literally the best thing since sliced bread. Quick and easy service also.

I‚Äôve been using Revolut for some time now as I travel back and forth from Spain. In comparison to my former UK high street bank, this app has been a big help; I just don‚Äôt worry about money issues from country to country. Travelling with one card and one app is very useful and the currency conversion simply saves money. There have been times when I have had to contact customer services with issues related to deposits and payments beyond the standard levels and everything has always been handled well. Compare that to ringing up my old bank, I‚Äôd far sooner recommend this way of banking every time. Compared to other banking apps for iOS, Revolut is at the top of my list. If they had offered sort codes and acc numbers sooner I probably would have chosen Revolut over Starling, but I‚Äôm pretty happy to use both apps, the latter being my day to day bank for now. However, Revolut is making good progress with developing their service and having a Euro IBAN is a great start. Developments next year to the app mean I‚Äôll finally be able to close my UK and Spanish bank accounts and amalgamate everything into one app.

If you want to find yourself wrapped up with several ¬£100‚Äôs worth of debt after returning from a holiday of a lifetime, then the Revolut service will gladly assist you achieving this. I personally used this service, which to be fair started of a great way to pay for anything instead of using and carrying large amounts of cash, but unfortunately the trouble came my way after two weeks of returning back in the uk , apparently Revolut transaction process becomes overwhelmed and can‚Äôt accomplish the demand of hundreds of thousands transactions, meaning at the time the funds leave your account but can‚Äôt be processed so it looks like you‚Äôve paid for your purchases but you haven‚Äôt because they can‚Äôt be processed because the system just can‚Äôt cope. I changed my remaining dollars back to British sterling and used them back in the uk, then I had a list of transactions reverted back to my Revolut account then taken again a few weeks later (which Revolut say can happen even months later) so Revolut took it upon themselves to take almost ¬£500 from a credit card I‚Äôd used to fund some of my funds on my Revolut card, which will occur intrest being added to said credit card account. So hats of to you at Revolut for providing such an outstanding service üò±

For the last four years I loved revolut, they always had a really clean user interface and the apps analytics section was a really handy tool for budgeting. Combined with the ease of currency exchange and vaults I genuinely loved the app. This was until the most recent major overhaul of the apps user interface. The app is now incredibly clunky, it‚Äôs very hard to find anything to the point the spending analytics are effectively useless for tracking spending. The app has become tedious to navigate and every time I try to find anything I find myself wasting time trying to work my way through the unintuitive UI. It couldn‚Äôt be more different from the revolut app I first started to use. I decided to leave it in the hopes that with time I would become used to the changes as I had with previous ones but I‚Äôve come to the conclusion that this just isn‚Äôt happening so am now looking to switch to a competitor (probably Monzo) which is a shame as the app used to be far superior. Classic case of if it‚Äôs not broken don‚Äôt try to fix it. Really hope revolut changes the UI back to something that more closely resembles its former intuitive UI, although I won‚Äôt hold my breath.

The product is decent and easy to use, but the customer service and ethics are absolutely dreadful. Probably the worst chat I‚Äôve ever encountered. After I was locked out of my account 2 months ago, I‚Äôve been given zero explanation as to why they‚Äôre holding my funds, even after fully cooperating with them and sending them further personal identification and information. I used revolut to deposit and pay for my rent, but due to being barred from my own money, I have not being able to pay for my rent on time and have incurred charges. 
Time and time again I‚Äôve tried getting an explanation as to why my money has being seized by this untrustworthy company front the in-app live agents but they‚Äôve all given me the exact general pre generated answer, telling me to wait around as the compliance team makes their checks, and they can‚Äôt give me a time frame or any type of information as to why they‚Äôve reappropiated my own, hard-earned money. Trying to contact them through twitter did not work either as they seem to just ignore the tweets sent at them looking for help but only reply to those praising them with gimmicky emojis.
Such a bad and untrustworthy company. 
STAY AWAY

I signed up as a way to get my money out of my coinbase account (no easy task, thanks coinbaseüôÑ). I‚Äôm pretty chuffed with it so far. It‚Äôs really easy to use, a little succinct in detail, like if you want to find out more info about certain t&cs or info on exchanging currency, its easier to search the web not the app. But the flip side is it feels a lot more user friendly because of this and not having loads of info to trawl through irrelevant blurb to get where you want. 

One big plus is they offer the interbank exchange rate to customers.  If you change money a lot this looks like a great way to do it. Though if you withdraw more than ¬£200 per month of the changed currency they charge 2%.  

I have one big problem, my account is still not verified because I think they don‚Äôt think my drivers licence pic matches my face snap. After two days I‚Äôm still waiting to hear back why my verification has failed until then I can‚Äôt do anything with my account. So maybe it‚Äôs a little early to give such a high score.  We shall see

This conpany is a joke! I am surprised that this is still happening in 2019. Imagine going in a holiday in Thailand. Obviously you will transfer money in your Revolut card for security concerns. And now imagine your account being ‚Äúunder review for suspicious activity‚Äù. First thing you‚Äôll do is trying to find a telephone number to contact Revolut team. There is none! All you can do is live chat within the app. So you open a live chat. A robot pops in. So you start talking to a robot that comforts you by assuring you that a live operator will be with you as soon as possible. For them, ASAP could be from 2 hours, 2 days, even 2 months. Don‚Äôt believe me? Type on any social platform including Twitter, Facebook,etc, in the search bar: ‚Äúrevolut blocked account‚Äù. You will convince yourself if it‚Äôs worth it. After i took the problem on twitter tagging them, they responded in one minute, just so after getting blocked. What sort of a prifessional company blocks their own users on Twitter?? 
Very unsatisfied about the entire thing. You should be ashamed of yourself as there are business owners that have employees to pay, there are hardworking people that hve rent and bills to pay, and they can‚Äôt do it because their accounts are ‚Äúunder review‚Äù for months.

I joined this app a few years ago because it offered a great service with low costs esp. when sending or spending money overseas. In the last couple of years it has offered new features that are irrelevant to me such as cryptocurrency and trading. I am suspicious of the low bar to entry in investing our money in these areas, where knowledge and experience is needed to make it worthwhile, and losing money is more likely for the inexperienced. However, those that want these features can take the opportunity and I can ignore them. 

Now the new design (7) irritates me. It is visually cluttered. Before I could see transactions at a glance when I opened the app. Now I‚Äôm still trying to work out which screen and object to click on to do this. It seems to be increasingly geared to expanding your involvement with its features, rather than everyday use of money. 

I would gladly pay a monthly fee for this app, but the features offered for their Premium tier clearly aren‚Äôt aimed at me - so I don‚Äôt. I still use it everyday but I find over time that it is increasingly being smothered with features and design obscuring it‚Äôs use.

Love this card. Super easy to use abroad and with the app it‚Äôs very clear what you‚Äôre spending/how much. It also allows you to get the best exchange rates on currency and transfer money back (for free) to your existing accounts if not needed. You can upload in your home country currency and it automatically exchanges it for the currency you‚Äôre spending in which is very handy. 

A few teething problems: I‚Äôve twice been on holiday now and tried to pay only to have the card rejected. This was highly inconvenient and means I don‚Äôt trust the card 100% and do carry some cash with me on trips (just in case). 

If you have any problems with the card good luck trying to get through to customer service! I‚Äôve been kept waiting for help for an entire day before. They have no phone numbers, you can only do it via a chat functionality, and so if you have a problem or query you rarely get on the spot assistance. That can be very frustrating and is the worst thing about this app. At times I‚Äôve thought about never using the card again it‚Äôs so bad!

I was really enjoying using revolut as a travel card and a place to put away spare change for when I needed it most. That was until my revolut account was hacked. 
As soon as I noticed I tried to get ahold of someone, no email address no number to speak to a person (number on the website just has you dealing with an automated robot) couldn‚Äôt log into my account thanks to the hackers so couldn‚Äôt get on the in app chat. 
Which lead me to twitter to contact someone who were actually very helpful, blocked my card and helped me try and get back into my account so I can see what damage the hackers have done. 
That was 3 days ago and I‚Äôve just been waiting for the right person to help me get into my account now. I understand the current climate doesn‚Äôt make things easier, but a 48hr wait for someone when your account has been hacked is just not good enough. Also how the hackers managed to take money out of my Halifax account without me approving their devices via email is an utter shambles. Even though I received emails asking me to verify the devices. The only way I knew my account had been compromised

Recently the app isn‚Äôt working on 100%. 2 days ago I wasn‚Äôt even able to log in for several hours, even uninstalling and resetting the password didn‚Äôt work (it didn‚Äôt even recognise the number btw). After several hours and not no option how to reach out costumer support, since your phone number is fully automated and chat is in app only, I was finally able to log in.

Today when I intended to to invest more money to shares the app stopped working again, not loading and giving me errors with most of the actions I did. The last drop was when I couldn‚Äôt even convert my own money into different currency or add money from my card. In app chat was only automatic as well. I was asked to wait 20 mins for an agent just to get another automatic message later that ma case is closed but nothing apart of link to Q&A. 

I used to love Revolut but I came to a conclusion that I can‚Äôt no more rely on it and trust you with my finances, therefore I will soon start looking for alternatives made your competitors. I am really sad that I have to do that. However, if you won‚Äôt improve your app‚Äôs reliability and especially your costumer support, you leave me no choice but leave.

If you travel a lot, need to keep a record of your spending, are paranoid enough to want every transaction come up in your phone as and when it happens, have a large family you have to transfer money to every now and then, or just need to split a bill in a restaurant with mates - Revolut is just brilliant. It‚Äôs even got travel insurance built in so when the phone detects that it is abroad - you‚Äôre automatically covered. After the complexity and issues I‚Äôve had with my normal bank when traveling - this company is solving a real problem and it‚Äôs been very helpful. 

As an added bonus - you get a much better exchange rate and pay in the local currency. 

Downsides - well they‚Äôve had a few offline moments but they‚Äôve warned me ahead of time and it‚Äôs not effected me personally. I understand from friends that if something goes wrong which is off script (ie not a regular issue) it can take a while to sort out.  Occasionally you get ‚Äòghost‚Äô payments registering that happen everywhere apparently and are refunded/not withdrawn - but you‚Äôre super aware of them on Revolut which can get a bit stressful. 

Other than that - this is a product I use regularly and I recommend it to you wholeheartedly. 

P.S. I realise this might sound a little overenthusiastic but genuinely, I‚Äôm so sick of crap companies doing a crap job - I‚Äôve started giving more respect and time to the companies that bother to do things well. Hence the lengthy review.

The App worked fine and was useful for trip abroad.. but be aware if you get your account frozen because of the automated fraud filters in place then the time quoted on the app is 96 hours!! for customer services to review evidence and unfreeze your money. I now have to provide a whole catalogue of evidence to prove I‚Äôm not money laundering (I‚Äôm not).. There is no email address or document upload facility, only app based response. Customer services send responses as push notifications at 4am to my phone (UK time). I can‚Äôt close my account and can‚Äôt withdraw my money. Imagine if this was your only source of funds and you were on holiday or abroad! The evidence Im required to provide will take hours to collate. They will say they are a financial institution that by law they have to check transactions..  but this has never happened to me with any other bank or credit card. I‚Äôm feel like I‚Äôm being asked to do their financial compliance work for them! Lots of similar comments on their app about accounts being frozen because people have made large transactions etc. Use at your own risk (not just because Money Saving Expert recommends it) and have another option for cash if you are using abroad.

I was once a Revolut advocate. Now it has too many customers with too many problems. Getting help through the app - the only way they will deal with anyone - is almost impossible. I was told 9 minutes yesterday to wait for an agent. 123 minutes later and I get nothing but scripted platitudes  and no concrete help. It was like talking to an idiot. It‚Äôs totally random as to how effective they might be.   Revolut app has become a sales platform rather than a money management application. All they do is push stuff at you. They partner with brands you don‚Äôt know, offer discounts few take up, push junior accounts when you don‚Äôt have kids, and the worst thing is this sanctimonious attitude they are so right! It‚Äôs never their fault, it‚Äôs not their fault when your card stops and is blocked for being at a petrol station they consider suspicious. It‚Äôs then hours before you can get it unblocked. Then they tell you you should always carry another card in case theirs stops working because they‚Äôre a disruptive bank and this sort of thing happens with ‚Äúnew tech‚Äù. Card payments have been around since the 1970‚Äôs! I‚Äôm through with Revolut now. Three years and I‚Äôm done.

Don‚Äôt be dazzled by their slick app. I (stupidly, in hindsight) transferred all my holiday spending money from my personal Bank account (with the same account holder name that matches my revolut account) the day before going abroad only to be notified that the transaction is pending while they continue to do their checks. 4 days have passed and nobody has got back to ask me to provide any further additional information to help speed up this process to release the funds. I‚Äôm literally begging them to tell me what Information I can send to help speed up this process so they can release my funds and unlock my account but all I get from using their online chat are endless replies from their autobots telling me how sorry they are for this delay, not to worry because it‚Äôs been elevated to correct department and to hope I have an amazing day! With lots of cute smiley faces and emojis. 4 days of no access to my funds in a foreign country with a young family and self catering. Unfortunately while trying to explain this through their online chat (because it‚Äôs impossible to actually call and speak with someone), all I get is the super polite autobot replies. You have been warned.

I have to agree with other users that while the idea of this app is great, it never seems to work and the customer service is terrible. I never actually managed to make a transaction using Revolut as it kept locking my account repeatedly ‚Äì even when I was online at the time with a service agent, whose attempts to fix it never actually worked! Most annoyingly, twice a merchant declined a transaction but Revolut still took the money out of my account ‚Äì swallowing it up as ‚Äúpending‚Äù for a week until I could request for it to be reversed. I‚Äôve ‚Äòlost‚Äô over ¬£400 this way, and like I said, am yet to experience a successful transaction. The customer service throughout these issues was also abysmal ‚Äì one agent simply stopped responding when the second declined/‚Äòpending‚Äô amount was taken from me; a terrifying experience when your money is being swallowed up for absolutely no reason, and you can‚Äôt communicate with the people who are swallowing it. Have subsequently taken all my money back and closed my Revolut account. Such a shame, but even more so such a waste of time, energy and money. Be careful with these guys!

Thank you for the app! It is so great! You guys have helped me a lot to track my spendings and make them lower. Thank you!

P.s. no offence, design team, you are great, but the old design with a graph was pretty good, and I really liked it!

I am sorry but this app it total pile of rubbish. Sure, let me explain. 
I hold top metal status, which supposed to provide as they say supreme customer service. The reality is appalling. 
Firstly, when I bought some crypto currency, I was charged 3% commission, yet, in my account it clearly stated that ‚Äúunlimited currency exchange‚Äù with metal status. Conversation with agent provided zero result. Hence, pure misleading of customers via advertising. 
Secondly, my trading account was blocked for pattern trading, i.e. more then 3 day trades within 5 days. However, the counter in the app told me that I still had 1 more trade... Do you know what they told me after 4 days waiting? There was a bug but we still cannot unblock your account for 90 days. They blamed me for suffering of the bug in their app... 
Finally, that suspension led to my loss in Tesla trade over 1000 USD. 
All of the above I am able to prove as I have screened all those facts and surely now taking it further with UK financial and advertising control authorities. 
DO NOT download this app, unless you want to become a test pilot for their mistakes and bugs, wasting your time, money and nerves.
I was dreaming about a fair and properly working bank. Revolut brought me tgis dream. I love the app and it covers all my need.

Premium? No, thanks. Before anyone signs for premium... think twice and read on. I was a big fan and promoter of Revolut since the very begining, signing up many friends. After moving to another conutry i chose the premium service and black account, which worked fine till i went on a trip... leaving for 800 km long trip i took with me my revo black card to be used as primary one. I charged it as needed. Worked fine on day 1 and 2, on day 3 my balance went low and i recharged from another card... and it happened. Account got charged and locked and i was instructed to chat. Getting support took almost AN HOUR. And they could do nothing, just offered a number of excuses. Account with all money was blocked and i was left in the middle of Italy, some 400 km from home. Support was incompetent, not wishing to resolve the thing immediately, but instructing to check it in a couple of days. Now, 2 days after i am still without my funds that i placed to revolut account... waiting. If i hadn‚Äôt got a backup card ... i would stay in foreign country without any money due to ‚Äúsophiaticated security system‚Äù and priority black account support. My money is practically stolen and no one cared. Shame... so unless you want to experience an immediate fund shortage... i advise to check n26, monese or any other providers, that care for customers even without charging them almost 15 euros a month for a service, that is later not preforming!

I‚Äôm currently traveling the EU and needed a simple and fast way to make purchases abroad and after trying other apps such as Transferwise and Xoom, I found Revolut way better with more features and customer service. Originally I opened the European version which did not work for US citizens but with money already deposited I thought it was a scam yet customer support was very helpful, pointed the direction I needed to take and refunded my deposit with ease. I now have the US version which lacks a little compared to the Euro version such as crypto currencies but it is still well worth it and hope to see that upgrade in the future. Regardless great app!! Keep up the good work Revolut!

I am in Italy where this product would be a great help and convenience if it were possible to load money into the virtual card.  I opened the account on May 2nd and transferred $20 to test how it works and found contactless payments to be superior to our primitive US cards which must be inserted into the payment terminals.  Excellent!  If there is no physical card, there is no possibility of skimming or reading the card details.
Unfortunately, it is now May 16th and I am no longer able to transfer funds into the card and the error message is that I have exceeded the limit of my card account.  My debit card has a daily limit of $1500 and I have been able to transfer less than $100 since May 2nd.  Customer Service is basically non-existent except for a childish chat bot which suggests I use a different (unavailable) method to top up the card.
I am offered the opportunity to upgrade to the premium version of the service but have no assurance it would would work any differently.
Revolut may be useful if only inside the United States but in Italy, it is simply frustrating and annoying.  Even if I were back home, I would still have only the one method of topping up the card from my debit card account.  I don‚Äôt actually see the point of a service that is so restrictive it can only be used upt to a limit of $100 and fails forever after.  One Star is too many!

I have stoped using Revolut. The main reason is their chargeback system. it is based od AI robot, and filling with online form. Your options to explain situations when you are complaining about transaction are limited and predefined by Revolut (so they know in advance all possible reasons why something happened). This leaves you to only select what they think is correct. Selecting something different will lead you to loosing your chargeback dispute. Late presented transaction by Merchants even beyond allowd days by Visa will be charged to your account. I have received such transactio. 12 days after a purchase date. Merchant was on my vacation trip, 1000 km from my place. On trip I paid merchant in cash (becouse transaction was not authorized), and If I want my goods i have to pay merchant on the spot with cash. 12 days later Revolut charged me as delayed transaction. This is my second bad exporience with Revolut, and what I hate avoit Revolut service is lack of human contact via email or phone number. There is no such support, only via Revolut App and there will be after you pass AU Robot, a person who will just blindly repeat everything what AI did before. Pointless. Think twice before you start to use Revolut service.

Very happy with the app and my account thus far. Regarding the app, Ive been utilizing the budgeting feature and have some notes:

If I change my budget for one month the app automatically changes my budget for the previous months as well. Fortunately, I‚Äôm able to personally keep track of when I do and do not stay under budget, but it would be nice if the budgeting feature took this into consideration.

Also regarding budgeting and accepting payments from friends: it would be nice if you could assign the payments from friends to say, a restaurant charge. I‚Äôve begun avoiding paying the bill with friends because it messes up my restaurant budget in the app. It would be cool if I could pay for a table of four, have my three friends pay me, then assign those payments to that restaurant charge. 

The app has all sorts of bells and whistles I don‚Äôt bother using. As the savings feature isn‚Äôt interest-bearing I don‚Äôt bother using it. I also don‚Äôt use the cryptocurrency feature since it seems pretty pointless when you can use other crypto-dedicated apps. I also don‚Äôt understand the donation feature‚ÄîI just donate to organizations directly. 

I really think they should just focus on making the existing tools work extremely well with what makes Revolut unique and interesting, rather than bloat the app and the service in an attempt at appealing to everyone and no one.

This has to be the most frustrating application I‚Äôve ever dealt with. I downloaded Revolut months ago and have only been able to add money about 5 times, although I have tried 47 times. I used to love everything about Revolut. Until recently they held my weekly payment for unemployment to verify its origin. Greetings to everyone that are interested in opening an account in Revolut. I want to share with you about my awful experience.
I have opened an account, subsequently there was an issue with the verification, so I contacted the customer service of Revolut. 
The Customer service was hacked somehow, and the people who represented themselves as Revolut employees stole 3000 pounds from my account. When I realized, it was too late. The bank said that my money was transferred into Revolut account. I‚Äôve contacted the police they‚Äôve opened an investigation, after that I‚Äôve collected all of the information , including phone calls, messages all of the information needed about this whole fraud, all they needed to do is block the account and refund my lost money, which they didn‚Äôt.
I am very disappointed I thought Revolut is reliable online bank for international use but apparently is not the company that claims to be!
Nobody answers my messages in the live chat or elsewhere. 
All I want to say is if you want your money safe think twice before opening an account in Revolut, they are not an reliable online bank, they couldn‚Äôt keep my money safe, next time it could be you.

ATTENTION! Revolut SHARES your personal data such name, app events, email with social media and advertising platforms by default! Go to Settings > Privacy > Marketing and turn it off manually!! This is really big GDPR issue!

Excellent customer support (if you‚Äôre pro, else you have to wait days, but hey, free means no priority support). Had no issues whatsoever except for 2 times they had problems with their payment processor. I could pay, but transactions were reverted and after a few days corrected. 

They have still growing pains, you should have a backup, I‚Äôm all in for 4 months and I love it. This is the future. 

Also support via chat is so convenient as you can answer later and don‚Äôt have to stay on the line to get help. You also can send screenshots. Very helpful. 

Beware that the pro version binds you to a 12 month contract. 

Your money is secure and guaranteed by 2 London banks and Apple Pay is coming later this year. 

Sorry US customers, as they are rate limiting subscribers. Don‚Äôt be paranoid it‚Äôs not a scam, they just can‚Äôt roll up infrastructure so fast. I imagine it will take another 6 months.

I absolutely love the app and what you guys are doing. I have been using N26 for 2 years and I am fully satisfied, the account opens in about 10 minutes via your smartphone, after opening the account the card arrives at your home within 4 days, really beautiful, transparent and you have to '' active the app, the account is really smart, you can do everything from your smartphone, withdrawals at any domestic and foreign counter are completely free, transfers in the SEPA area are free and arrive in less than 24 hours, assistance in very present application, really user friendly application, the account can currently be powered only by bank transfer or cash through the cash26 service in the participating supermarkets, in the end I would recommend it because unlike other accounts it is really completely free.

Opened a free account here recently, observations:

Positive:
- really free under normal usage (eg max 5 ATM withdrawals per month)
- excellent exchange rates
- decent mobile app (+ website!)
- easily save/organise money using ‚ÄúSpaces‚Äù
- push notifications for all account activity
- debit MasterCard

Negative:
- Apple Watch app is broken (crashes 80% of the time; large complication shows wrong info, small complication is just a logo and doesn‚Äôt show account balance, like e.g. Revolut does)
- Maestro card not available in Belgium, where MasterCard is not accepted most of the times at local merchants... unfortunately, this is a pretty big deal and in practice forces you to use N26 as a ‚Äòsecondary bank account‚Äô only, since you always have to carry another Maestro card from another bank with you
- Can only top up through bank transfer (or from other N26 users; no other instant top-up options)
- App appears to be a bit buggy at times (requiring to login again using long password instead of Touch ID, overlapping UI elements on the main screen, ...)
- you can only keep 2 Spaces on the free account (need to upgrade for more)
- No Apple Pay yet in Belgium (and no info on when it will be available)

(also, yesterday I used my card at a store and a few minutes later took some cash out of an ATM; didn‚Äôt get any notifications for either transaction and it took 2 hours or so before the app showed the correct updated balance; not sure though if this is a one-time issue or if it will happen more frequently)

I am unable to access my account because I don‚Äôt have a European phone number. It did not say this would be an issue when I signed up, but I can‚Äôt even receive my card. In order to cancel my account and transfer my money out, I still need to get a European phone number. Cancelling ASAP!
