The app is good and responsible but some features are missing:

- ability to schedule regular transfers from main account to spaces. If the whole point of this is putting money aside for something, without a scheduling system in place, it doesn‚Äôt make a lot of sense IMHO

- when scrolling down, balance changes based on your history. This is not a great user experience as it may lead a user to think he or she has more money at some point in time. The functionality is good but I would show current balance as a fixed value on top

- for spaces, it would be a good thing to allow users to upload some custom pictures as background image. This way, the goal setting feature would be even more powerful

- also, two factor authentication needs to be implemented for security reasons

Overall the app is good but with some more thought on certain things it would be a killer app.

I am a customer of N26 in the UK with metal membership. To my mind N26 provides a very basic account, although N26 has some nice features like spaces. Things I like about N26 metal: access to airport lounges, travel insurance and free ‚Äúunlimited‚Äù cash withdrawals abroad are included in metal membership. When I had issues with free unlimited cash withdrawals support said that I can only withdraw 500 GBP each 24 hours. Why there is a setting in app allowing to control a daily withdrawal limit which I set to 2500 I don‚Äôt know.
Things I don‚Äôt like:
Personally, I find interface very confusing and unintuitive and always struggling to find what I need.
Fingerprint log-in is only for 30 days and it‚Äôs very annoying when app requests password at the moment when you need to open app urgently and have to dig out the password (I don‚Äôt remember all my passwords).
There is no possibility to keep various currencies, so I cannot exchange in advance when exchange rate is favourable.
Top up is only possible via bank transfer and not via N26 app itself.
In general, simplicity is good but N26 for me is a bare current account with the only feature I actually find useful - spaces. The rest useful things are perks of metal membership.

I have been on the fintech scene for a few years now, having invested in Monzo (when it was known as mondo), along with having an account with Starling Bank from the start....also greatly anticipating Revolut‚Äôs current account due end of 2019. N26 is far above the aforementioned, I am a metal subscriber - the price is more expensive than my Metal with Revolut, however my money feels far more secure and the CS very personal.

 I am yet to use the lounge access with my N26 Metal but I‚Äôm sure it will be a breeze. Everything has been very seemless from opening to upgrading my account, very effortless with transfers and requests and extremely pleasing. 

When a transaction is questioned - N26 will push notify me in the app to approve that transaction rather than blocking the transaction and making you call CS etc. 
It‚Äôs very helpful when your abroad and also details the local currency as well as the converted rate into your home currency. I don‚Äôt miss calling Lloyd‚Äôs to tell them I was going abroad. Also whilst abroad there‚Äôs no fees from N26 just the standard daily mastercard rate which is usually less than 1% in most currencies. 

The fact that many high street banks are now offering what N26/Monzo/Starling and Revolut have offered from the start shows they‚Äôre running scared. 2.5M users of this bank cant be wrong. 

I love using my N26 card and I do get a lot of questions when people hold it, it‚Äôs smooth heavy and looks gorgeous, people often sign up on the spot when they‚Äôve held the card! 

I hope that N26 will offer concierge soon and cashback in a chosen currency or crypto like Revolut. 

Keep doing what your doing - it‚Äôs perfect.

In general the N26 app is much better than the traditional banking apps that I've used (especially in terms of its design and features). I particularly love the instant notifications, categorization feature, integration with TransferWise, and the ability to adjust limits etc. However, the app is also very buggy and inconsistent, which is not ideal in a banking app, which I want to be able to trust.

First, the Touch ID login has been very buggy in the last month or two. About 30% of the times I open the app, it freaks out, presents a bunch of errors, and shows my balance but not transactions. I have to force quit the app, relogin, and reenable the Touch ID feature.

Second, for the past few months I have not been able to add a new recipient in currencies other than Euro (i.e. using the TransferWise integration). When I choose "Add new recipient" and try to change the currency, I am given the error "Something has gone wrong. We'll look into it in a sec". I can still do transfers to recipients that I had already created previously; I just can't create new recipients.

Third, when I complete a bank transfer, I get the popup to confirm the transaction, but the transfer screen doesn't close after I confirm. After hitting confirm, the transfer screen is left open, and I have to back out of it, screen by screen. So it is unclear whether the transaction actually happened. Worrying.

Fourth, when I manually set a category for a transaction, sometimes that new category doesn't stick and it changes back randomly at some future date. It's good that the app tries to guess the appropriate category, but if I manually set the category it should be changed permanently.

Finally, some suggestions. The set of categories are a bit weird. For example, the "Household & Utilities" category is very general ‚Äì rent, bills, furniture, household items are lumped into one broad category. "Media & Electronics" should be two separate things. There is no Clothing category. The stats feature is nice, but month by month pie charts are not super useful; it would be great if I could see expenditure by category over time on a line graph for example. Here in Italy, the ATM map is terrible ‚Äì most ATMs aren't on the map and many ATMs on the map don't actually exist.

Moving from a big UK bank to N26 is like jumping out of a milkfloat and into a BMW concept car. I felt like I was in an episode of black mirror when the verified my identity documents with a video call; even accessing my front camera and turning on the torch! I could also activate my new card with the app in 10 few seconds and I can now login to see my transactions almost instantly using my fingerprint ‚Äìwhich is with me a lot more of the time than the three, calculator sized card readers that my old banks required me to carry at all times like a giant set of plastic keys. I'm sure it won't take long to adjust to life without nebulous fees and bad exchange rates on international transfers (to fund morally questionable banking executive bonuses). It's also nice knowing I can now forget my mother's cat's maiden name and my third uncles date of birth along with several long strings of numbers and still be able to make online payments. Maybe, in time, I will look back nostalgically on the days when I had to pay a fee every time I used a cash machine or, God forbid, travelled to another country. I may also miss spending 20 jaw clenching minutes on hold to ask for a new PIN number and then waiting a week for it to be physically posted to me. I'm able to do this in 3 seconds in the app. Also, the fact that N26 identify and categorise all my card transactions and make a little graph of how I'm spending my money is a mixed blessing... Now I'm painfully aware that I the new iPhone 7 I didn't really need costs more than I spend on food and rent. (Thankfully, as they all look the same now, my girlfriend hasn't noticed). My only complaint is that the app doesn't show me a little graph of how much time and money I wasted with my old bank, who have been discreetly skimming me since the mid 1980's. If N26 do decide to roll with this it would nice if the infographic included a little animation of a Barclays bank executive spanking me just before the bar chart animation.

Use the code diegov4053 to receive 15 euros for the first transaction made with your debit card N26.

I have been using N26 for over two years and I can be very satisfied. The account opens in about 20 minutes directly from your smartphone and is completely free.
Within 4 days you receive the debit card at home (transparent for the standard account, really cool) which you activate from the app in just a few steps.
Unlike other banks, the PIN is not sent by post but is managed directly by the app.

In short, the strengths are:
- Fantastic website both graphically and functionally
- Fantastic app both graphically and functionally
- Fantastic the money beam function that allows you to transfer money to other N26 accounts in a few seconds
- Excellent cataloging of the expenses made and payments received
- Null commission on withdrawals

Weaknesses:
- The assigned IBAN is German so a SEPA transfer is required to transfer money or use the cash 26 service at participating supermarkets

I recommend you think very, very carefully before trusting N26 with an account and your hard-earned money.

If I could give N26 zero-stars, I would!

I haven‚Äôt even revived my card or Activated it yet I am in ¬£29.80 negative balance. Help desk was the worst I‚Äôve every spoken to not in the slightest bit helpful. 
Absolutely shocking DO NOT GET THIS CARD!

I put in my correct birthdate in order to open an account (March 9 2001) but it tells me to contact customer support. I am 18 and it seems to be registering me as a minor, not allowing me to proceed. I tried changing the year to 2000 and it worked. Why is it registering me as a minor?

The customer service has got even worse. When using live support SCREENSHOT THE CONVERSATION REPLIES FROM THEM.

I will be posting these online. I suggest we all do this and highlight how BAD the bank is globally.

Any basic function. ‚ÄòSorry we are unable to do this!‚Äô 

A BANK!!!!!!!

Initially, I was so happy with the day to day functioning of the account. Good app. Getting the upgraded card took weeks. Nevertheless, I was mostly content. Not all companies and websites accept a debit MasterCard which was irritating to say the least. Also, they can‚Äôt deal with dollars!? Big currency. Major trading currency. Nope! That‚Äôs out! Metal bank card! Seems nice till you try to destroy it for security reasons. Whether they have switched it off or not. You do not want an indestructible bank card with your name on being dropped in the bin. 

Why one star? 

If you solely want an account that works in the UK go for it. HOWEVER! Unlike normal UK bank accounts - you do not have an IBAN. Rendering it functionally useless if you want to live in an ever increasing modern global economy. The concept of anything outside the UK was met with incredulous contempt. 

Having sent a very clear request. The man did not have the ability to understand it. As if basic world geography was a mystery to him. To receive any payment from abroad you get referred to a third party website. Perhaps, if you are making a casual transfer between friends and family. That might be acceptable to you. Yet, if you have registered your bank details with anyone official, like a governmental body and paid money for it to be notarised and made official over four months. The chances of asking an employee in Peru who may or may not speak English to do this would be unlikely. Having to follow strict regulations and protocol. Having lived there. It would be a 70/30 chance they do not speak English. The looming prospect of this being successful would be akin to winning the Euromillions. Which would be pointless as you wouldn‚Äôt be able to receive that either as you do not have an IBAN.

Therefore, having to explain to a Peruvian national that their government has to use a third party website was a miserable prospect. The website, would have never been accepted anyway, even more so that it had not been listed on the legal documentation (which cost money to notarise) you completed before flying 13000km home. 

When I commented well other UK banks have an IBAN number. I will have to open a new account and restart a long and lengthy legal process. The gentleman asked. Well if the Peruvian government could open a UK bank account. They could easily transfer it. Full marks for optimism. Zero marks for living in the world of political and economic reality.

By this point I was beyond even attempting to dignify his ineptitude and idiocy with a response. Yes, a country would love to open a bank account in another country,  on another continent for one man‚Äôs convenience. I stated: ‚ÄúWell there is little use of this account really! I wish I hadn‚Äôt bothered if I had known!‚Äù Not an apology at all. No customer service skills. An instant response: ‚ÄúWell you can close your account. I will email you the form to fill in now.‚Äù Again, full marks that was there promptly. He was either very efficient or this is now a common occurrence and well rehearsed.

Later that day. To spare months of paperwork, waiting, and hundreds of pounds in translation costs and notary costs. I scoured the N26 app. The FAQs stated that the information I needed would be printed on my statements. Ten minutes of clicking randomly to locate a fundamental foundation of a bank account. ‚ÄòThe Bank Statement‚Äô.  Low and behold. It did not contain - said information.

Emailed customer services to enquire. Remember. The FAQs said I could locate this information using my app. Not that I expect customer service to be any better or enhanced for someone who has paid for the more premium service. I asked where do I find the information for the third party website. Out of sheer desperation now. I was willing to try and ask the Peruvian government if they could use this website. and get hold of a substantial amount of money I need. 

I was greeted with a sentence. Contact the third party, let them help you. Smashing. 

For your own health and happiness. Sanity. Self-worth and dignity. Do not use this bank. A simple web search brings up multitudes of banks which offer exactly the same add ons for a monthly fee. N26 is not that special in that regard. Now I am leaving and finding a new bank. So many banks offer far more services that you need. Do not invest in them even for a temporary time. They are incompetent and rude. Offering a substandard service and lacking in technology which was available in the last century. 

Epic and appalling on every level. Fail.

The bank is quite nice but the only problem i have is that i have to enter account number and sort code each time i want to send money. The App should be able to save details of account details i have sent money to just like all other bank Apps

Also, I can‚Äôt find a way to turn off ‚Äòdiscrete mode‚Äô, so all the amounts shown in the app are blurred out. The app settings has an option to use the phone‚Äôs proximity sensor to activate discrete mode, but it doesn‚Äôt change anything when on or off.

I was trying to transfer money from another checking account to get started and got an error message. My N26 balance was still showing as $0.00, but the money came out of my old checking account. Then she said if my address from my old bank account doesn‚Äôt match what N26 was on file, it wouldn‚Äôt work. I explained that the transaction did go through and is showing ‚Äúaccepted‚Äù on my end. Still took my money though. It will be 1-2 business days to get a refund and with the weekend coming up, this is very inconvenient. I got a business account and the first thing I did is transfer some money to myself from my other account and then to a couple clients in USA and Indonesia through the N26 business account. I was told to use transfer wire. It said I can‚Äôt transfer any money internationally or receive any money from a non SEPA country using N26 business. What‚Äôs the point having a business account if I can‚Äôt receive or send money anywhere in the world. I‚Äôm being limited by my bank where I can and cannot do business. Imagine me on a business travel in a non SEPA country being able to cash out money from any atm but can‚Äôt receive money from there. What‚Äôs the point? I was later told to close my business account and apply for a new personal account. Which is again annoying. I expected better from a bank that promises to break any banking barriers. 
It means they want me to use another bank as my primary bank account to receive or transfer money to my non SEPA clients or during my travel. There are some advantages of holding a N26 business account but this is a real deal breaker not being able to transfer or receive money to anyone I want. So my suggestion to anyone who wants to get a business account is get a personal account or just go to another bank.

I have have gotten an iPhone every year since the first generation iPhone. Needless to say I have countless apps, but never have I been compelled enough to right a negative review. I really loved this account until I used this account to pay for a hotel... BIG mistake. I went to Vegas for a long weekend where I checked in on the 13th of December where I was charged $358 which broke down to $158 for resort fees & $200 to insure that I didn‚Äôt trash the room. That was on hold. On the 17th I checked out & the hotel rep stated that the $358 charge will turn into a $158 charge when the $200 dollars was released back to my account. So the charge from the hotel reverted to $158. Now typically, when you have a hold on your account or receive some type of refund, you get it back between 3-10 business days. I called today, December 6th. Just under a month later, & the only explanation is ‚Äúwait‚Äù. Bad enough the conversation was via chat, I had to explain my situation twice due to the app crashing on me. I‚Äôm giving them 2 more days before I call the Better Business Bureau. My December & January statement shows a value that currently shows that the amount is on my account but yet it‚Äôs now reflecting on my balance. It‚Äôs like $200 are just floating around in limbo. I‚Äôve waited long enough.

Please do not use this institution, especially if you‚Äôre going to make frequent and/or larger deposits $500+ or use your card and account for anything other than standard purchasing at conventional stores, markets etc. Anything else they will flag your account freezing it until they decide to undo this. In doing this they provide no reason nor timeframe for the freeze and show complete lack of concern for the the fact that they are keeping your money from you that is needed to survive everyday life. This has happened twice in a month to me. The first time it was 3 weeks before I was able to use my account and with the 1st transaction (cash app) my account was frozen again and as of today (June 14, 2020) I have heard nothing from N26 and my account is still froze. I have filed a complaint with the FDIC and the CFPB. From what I hear this institution does this quite often, more than any other and both of the above mentioned offices are actively looking into this matter. 

I advise moving all of your money out of this institution and then closing your account. N26 is not a bank, the actual bank that holds your money for them is Axios Bank. Search it under the FDIC website‚Äôs ‚ÄúBank Find‚Äù section.

Overall I thought I would of liked this bank, but, there are unhelpful parts to using this bank 1. I had submitted a claim for a refund and was late into the 30 days wait time whether or not N26 would pre approval a temporary credit into my account then to find out they took the company‚Äôs side in whatever the submitted in the claim on there behalf so the $50 I never got back from the complaining company that I TOTALLY lost. I then had to pay $50 back to the bank this SAD!!! And 2. You must have direct deposits or money transfers from banks you must call customer service to place on you‚Äôre account for bank to bank transfers. There is NO WAY to deposit cash to add money into you‚Äôre account this way my 2nd big issue with this bank. And finally 3. The customer service isn‚Äôt very helpful when it matters the most not in either things I just mentioned above. The only good side is there is no fees or monthly charges to keep using this online & app bank services ONLY. And you‚Äôre direct deposit does go straight to your account as it should. So close by saying that in the end it‚Äôs up to you the ppl. if you choose to bank with N26. I‚Äôm stuck losing out on my $50 which isn‚Äôt right...

When I first heard news that N26 was going to be launching as an online bank in the US I was ecstatic. I was just about to head to college and needed a easily manageable bank account to manage my money. 

I signed up to be among the first to have access to creating an N26 account and when the time came I registered to open an account. Shortly after while doing all this on the app I was prompted to contact customer support because there was an issue in creating my account. After waiting on the line for 15 minutes I spoke with a very professional employee who said would try to see what‚Äôs wrong with creating the account. After being put on hold again for a short while I was told that I cannot create an account with N26 and that the N26 customer support system cannot disclose further information on this decision. I was left speechless as the conversation came to an awkward and abrupt end. 

I‚Äôm heavily disappointed in the service that was given. I can understand there being an issue in creating the account but withholding the reasons as to why that is is beyond me. I really wanted to love N26 but not a single positive thing has resulted from it for me.

I did extensive research about various types of banks before opening up my account (flexibility, ease of access, ATM withdrawals, fees, exchange rates etc) and found that N26 is by far the best bank. I travel often so simplistic, easy to use and (very) convenient updates make traveling easy. You are able to withdraw money from any ATM without any hidden fees (up to 5x a month). Everything is online (there is no physical location) so no hidden fees about having opening an account. When you make a purchase the mobile app notifies me before the transaction completes. The ease and flexibility is amazing. Online wire transfers are a breeze, and options to save for investments, business or travel is extremely easy by depositing money into your created files (which can be customizable). I have told many of my international friends about N26 and they have agreed...it‚Äôs the best they‚Äôve ever used as well.

App is very easy and Debit Card came very fast. Account opening process is unbeatable with no admin and no headaches and ultra-quick! Congrats to N26 team! Account is opened within the app in a snap and it will verify your ID and you‚Äôre ready to go. Linking your external bank accounts to N26 is also very easy as well as moving money works like a charm. Can‚Äôt wait to see more what‚Äôs coming. Apple Pay doesn‚Äôt work yet but should be up soon after beta mode is over (was told ETA end of August for US accounts). Some features like check and cash deposits should be added and hope that will come in due course. Based on fees N26 is better than Revolut with no foreign transaction fees and no account fees.

Stole $313 from me for legit no reason. My account was in pristine compliance. Legit money coming in, legit bills and online shopping going out. With no warning they preemptively stole my money froze the account now nearly two weeks later I‚Äôm told this is RANDOM and any account is at risk of a compliance check which takes an undetermined amount of tome. Basically a month, 18 months a decade. It doesn‚Äôt matter there‚Äôs nothing you can do but take them to arbitration which is what I am doing. Floating your money much like criminals do with check kitting. So if your money and having access to it is of importance to you I would sooner bury my cash in my back yard or ‚Äúhide it in an ‚Äúindiscriminate ‚Äú place such as in my freezer or under my mattress before trusting the unscrupulous banksters at N26.

There are a few positive things about N26 banking but definitely falls short compared to similar institutions. Pros: Easy account opening process - Fast delivery of debit card - Higher purchase and withdrawal limits on debit card.
Cons: Poorly designed mobile banking compared to competitors - Lack of customer support (non via phone and limited hours via chat) - Long waiting period for external bank transfer despite of using your other bank‚Äôs online log in access which supposed to makes the transfer faster as they‚Äôre accessing your external account using your security credentials - Lack popular transfer options such as Zelle - No option for ordering checks - Unclear details about referral rewards (amount of reward) 
Overall N26 falls way behind compared to it‚Äôs other similar Internet banking competitors.

Customer service is terrible, all of their responses to fix things are generic and copy and pasted .. i mean just look at the complaints on these reviews and look at their response.. it‚Äôs literally the SAME response for each problem...  i had direct deposited my paycheck into this account in May 2020, after two days they suspended my account first stating it was ‚Äúroutine account check‚Äù and someone would notify me on the next t steps..... it is now August and I am still waiting on the next steps... no access to funds during this pandemic... no reason why I can‚Äôt access my account, they don‚Äôt respond to emails or phone calls and the o ly way to get in touch with anyone is through the app chat, and they literally say the same response word for word....3 months and counting..... same thing...... contacted BBB no response... now will be contacting lawyer and FTC... stay away from this bank...

Exceptional app. Love the banking experience, the 2 free ATMs a month which I found to be just perfect for me, I don‚Äôt use ATMs that much but when I do, I love that N26 will take care of those fees for me. The app is made to perfection and it also helps you put some money aside without the conventional Savings account. With spaces you can put money aside for whatever reason and I love that after you send money into a ‚Äúspace‚Äù that money will be taken out of you ‚Äúcurrent balance‚Äù section and it will only show up at the respective ‚Äúspace‚Äù you sent it to, making it less likely for you to spend that money. I absolutely LOVE N26. It‚Äôs been a game changer in all areas of my life. It‚Äôs simple, versatile and has everything I need to manage my finances from the get go.

HOWEVER, with the recent home screen overhaul, one of my favorite features was removed! Beforehand, when you would scroll down the transactions list, the account balance would AUTOMATICALLY change to show how much you had after the last shown transaction. After the update, that no longer happens and I have to manually calculate my balance for any given point. It was one of my favorite features because it allowed me to gradually see how my initial balance was spent over time, giving me more info to act while planning ahead.

I urge the N26 developers to reimplement this in any given way. I‚Äôm sure many other users miss it too.

I have been using N26 for 2 months now and have had to contact support 20+ times to get my account setup. Their verification process is old school and clunky. You need to go withdraw from an ATM and then wait around for a 24 hour period with no estimation for when you might hear from them. Overall, it seems like a good concept and it‚Äôs a nice application‚Äî but for anything where you need to contact support they are super unreliable. A bank that in my opinion paves a gateway for the next generation of banking lead by a company based in Europe. Can't pay bills. Can't send money or transfer out. Can't deposit or write checks. Can't get a complete answer from chat support's scripted replies. Money only can go in via direct deposit or bank transfer, and only can go out by using the debit card to spend or get cash. 

After realizing how useless N26 was, I asked to close my account. They said I either had to empty it first or transfer it all to another N26 account! N26 is the real deal! I was so thankful to be able to set up my account within a day without needing work authorization, resident permits, credit checks, or any of the other mountain of paperwork that other German banks may require. As a U.S. citizen staying for under 90 days as a scholar not making any money (and as someone who didn‚Äôt have any luck opening a bank account stateside until the very last minute), this was a boon. 

Two issues however:
There are two times when N26 will send you PIN codes via SMS. The first time is during your video call to verify your identity with your passport. I got this one just fine. The second time is after the video call in order to activate your account. Apparently because my phone number is in the U.S., I did not get this one. There is a workaround for this because I ultimately opened my account but there is nothing online warning users that certain countries‚Äô phone numbers won‚Äôt be able to receive the second PIN via SMS. 

The auto-reply to my customer service request said they would take some undetermined amount of time to get back to me, but to use the chat function either on the website or in the app if the issue was urgent (and the issue was urgent). This brings me to my second issue: the chat function took me days to access. First of all, because my account wasn‚Äôt activated, I couldn‚Äôt get into the app. Second of all, the website link they sent me wanted me to login - again, couldn‚Äôt get in because my account wasn‚Äôt activated. I eventually found the chat function in the FAQ portion of the website, but even then, it‚Äôs only available on certain FAQ pages (the one I found it on was ‚Äúpersonal information: changing your personal data‚Äù). The graphic for the chat button is a small, thin light grey outline of a speech bubble, which makes it hard to see. I don‚Äôt know if they purposely make it hard to find to allow their customer service team some breathing space but I don‚Äôt think it should be that hard to get help! Once I found the button though, an agent was patched through to me very quickly and solved my problem in minutes by informing me that I never got the second PIN because my number was from the US and by sending me the PIN over chat (after verifying that I was who I said I was!). So ultimately, my frustrations with N26 were things that are avoidable so I‚Äôm hoping that by writing this review I can help someone successfully open an account with them too. I do still recommend them and their customer service team.

Where to start. I was a part of the Beta launch, and very much looking forward to using the service. This quickly turned into a nightmare. When I had a student loan refund of $5200 direct deposited, my account was locked for ONE WEEK - access denied to my money. After numerous calls, I was told that, "Supervisors instructed us not to further discuss your account and any communication must be done via e-mail." To say that I was outraged would be an understatement. I researched N26 on the net and found that their entity in the EU is under investigation by the German Government for horrible customer service, seizure of accounts, numerous consumer complaints, etc. I also found their physical address in NY on Madison Ave and the phone number listed was the mobile number for their CEO who I spoke with and was brushed off and dismissed, citing that he, "Doesn't handle customer service calls." as he rushed me off the phone. It wasn't until a very kind Supervisor named Virginia helped me through the documents that their back office asked me to send... Explanation of expenditures, receipts, and even proof of being registered at my University!! It wasn't until I involved my Attorney that my account was unblocked, no reason as to why it was locked for a week. Two days after this I received a reason being that an attempt to purchase at a Rush Street Gaming app violated a "no gambling policy." This is outrageous considering The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania passed and legalised online gaming, and the purchase attempt was only a few hundred dollars. At the time, there was NO mention of this in their terms and conditions, which I printed and furnished my Attorney proof of the matter. In the US, there are only 3 reasons a bank can lock an account, all of the high require a WRITTEN notice to the customer. Beware of N26 and their illegal practices! Do NOT allow this to happen to you and if it has, call your Attorney right away to file legal recourse!

I‚Äôm normally not the kind of person to go on the App Store to write bad reviews or any review of any kind, but this bank practically robbed me ‚Äî so this is more of a warning to people considering getting this app... rather than a plain bad review.

I downloaded it and made an account with the idea of using this account as a prepaid / Work only account. First of all the debit card took three weeks to arrive to my house rather than ‚Äú5 business days‚Äù. Second, they only allow you to make an Apple Pay transfer your first time, after that it‚Äôs strictly via bank routing numbers or whatever... Literally the Apple Pay transaction was the only fast and successful transaction I made on this app. So I transferred some money from my Chase account to this N26 account the second time (which is now through bank transfer) and it said it would take ‚Äú5 business days‚Äù to transfer. I made the transfer on Thursday meaning that I should‚Äôve at least had the transfer by wednesday of the following week. By Monday, Chase already had those $75 withdrawn from my account, however, when I went over to N26 to check my balance, it was still at $0.00. So I contacted the support team via live chat and the person said that transfers take ‚Äú2-3 business days‚Äù and that they haven‚Äôt received anything so that I should contact Chase. I was confused that the support person told me 2-3 days when the app itself said 5 days... but anyway, I called chase and they mentioned that the transaction had gone through with N26 and it was no longer a pending transaction so now only N26 could take care of it. As I‚Äôm trying to contact the support people on the N26 app, I‚Äôm noticing that the live support tab is somehow not available. So I checked for a message form ( which they did have) and I typed my concern feedback. When I clicked ‚Äúsubmit‚Äù it showed an error message over and over again. I tried again later and then it showed both live chat and message form were unavailable. So now I have no way to contact them as they do not have an email address available to reference. This has been the most stressful week of trying to get my $75 and I had to go on a strict budget to last me through the week because of this. 

Save yourself the trouble and don‚Äôt use this app!!!!!

My initial experiences with N26 were extremely positive with a well functioning app and easy to use payment. However, due to system limitations on the part of the bank and the complete lack of reliable customer service, I‚Äôve realized that N26 is not a bank you can trust. 

For over 2 weeks, I have not been able to log into my account and have contacted customer service via the chat function to get help. At first I didn‚Äôt think twice, but in the event that you really need to get something done, a chat function is completely inadequate means of contacting a bank. Therefore, I would never entrust N26 to be my primary bank where my income gets deposited because the risk that you cannot reach someone is simply too high. Furthermore, I learned that the chat function only works via the web app version and not the mobile app on iOS. Therefore, you the customer have to find industrious ways to contact them! 

Nevertheless, after several chats with their customer service via the webapp version, I was forced to get a new SIM card so that I could perform two-factor authentication. Having done so, I needed to verify my new phone number which required again, contacting customer support and performing a withdrawal at an ATM. Then you have to contact chat support again to verify all these details within a timeframe of 24 hours. If you have the time to permanently be waiting in queue for chat support then you get promised a get a call back within 3 hours where you need to give a password to finally set it up. At least in theory this is. 

Needless to say, I never received this phone call. My account is locked for me to access now for 2 weeks and I‚Äôm unable to get any help. Basically N26 has my money ransom. I‚Äôve reached out to chat support again... they told me, ‚Äúplease be patient‚Äù. I guess 2 weeks of patience is not enough and that my ability to not access my account is not critical to them. 

No telephone, no real person, no work-around. Bank at your risk.
Honestly, don‚Äôt be fooled by the gimmickry of this online bank... If you can‚Äôt access your account, there‚Äôs no reason for the app or anything else.

I absolutely love N26! It took me a total of 7 minutes to setup an account and get approved. I can do banking in my native language, English. The customer service is excellent and they speak English as well. The convenience of doing banking solely online has really been wonderful and the fact that there are no monthly fees is so nice as it is rare here in Germany. I have used my card all over Europe and in America with no issues. I withdrew money at ATMs in America with no ATM fees, no transaction fees and got the real-time exchange rate! The app also makes lovely pie charts to track spending. If you are looking for a modern bank without the limitations of a brick & mortar bank, give Number26 a try!

I really enjoyed N26 for over a year now. The apps functionality is outstanding. 
What I didn't enjoy is the "banks" internal policy and customer service though. They canceled my overdraft for no apparent reason and are reluctant to give information about the reasons for downgrading my creditworthiness. "Thats up to internal algorithms and we're not obliged to give informations about this to customers". Not a chance to actually speak to someone in charge through the customer service and no answer to mails.
Following the recent account recalls for customers that used the account in a way N26 obviously didn't like (money withdrawal more than 5 times/month) I cannot recommend this banks service any more. They even offer an investment function now.. but why should I lend money to a bank with such an inconclusive service?

What kind of banking system is this where you have to cancel a card every time there‚Äôs something wrong? You‚Äôre not going to get far if you‚Äôre trying to compete with big banks where you can dispute / deal with a single a transaction effortlessly.

They canceled and stated they were resending me a card when I had not agreed to it (if they would have stated the policy first I would have said no as the disputed transaction amount was not work waiting a WEEK during a Pandemic to be able to access MY MONEY. 

Oh yeah while your card is being sent to you, you will not have any access to your money until you get your new card and activate it.

BTW since they like to automatically do things without confirming with the customer first they sent my card to the WRONG ADDRESS (I relocated from New York to another state because of the pandemic) 

When you transfer money over from one ‚Äúsquare‚Äù/savings to your main account it lags, so don‚Äôt need to be able used immediately after.

This bank isn‚Äôt supported in so many aspects, there‚Äôs multiple online retailers where my card is declined because it‚Äôs not supported. 

The card is pretty and it‚Äôs a mobile app. Those are your only benefits.

I have been using N26 for over two years and I can be very satisfied. The account opens in about 20 minutes directly from your smartphone and is completely free. During the opening it is necessary to keep your ID card close at hand and in the within 4 days you receive the debit card at home (transparent for the standard account, really cool) which you activate from the app in just a few steps.
Unlike other banks, the PIN is not sent by post but is managed directly by the app.

In short, the strengths are:
- Fantastic website both graphically and functionally
- Fantastic app both graphically and functionally
- Fantastic the money beam function that allows you to transfer money to other N26 accounts in a few seconds
- Excellent cataloging of the expenses made and payments received
- Null commission on withdrawals

Weaknesses:
- The assigned IBAN is German so a SEPA transfer is required to transfer money or use the cash 26 service at participating supermarkets

GIVE THIS BANK AT LEAST A YEAR BEFORE SIGNING UP!!! And then probably go with Simple instead anyway. 

I NEVER take the time to write reviews for things because usually my experiences, no matter how bad they are, don‚Äôt warrant such action my part. N26 is a COMPLETELY different story though. 

Pros: Their cards look cool

CONS: Their service is THE ABSOLUTE WORST! Think Comcast but as a bank. First, to verify your account you have to have the numbers on the front of it and the social, which for normal people is plenty. But oh no! Not them! You also need to have the amount AND benefactor of your 5th transaction. Because that‚Äôs reasonable. 

Next, Address changes. If you need to change your address you‚Äôll have less hassle changing banks and getting a new passport. I moved a month ago. I went on their app to change my address. Normal thing that people do all the time. It only gives you the option to change the SHIPPING address for a card. But I thought to myself ‚Äùself, if it‚Äôs in the app that must be the proper address change thing to use.‚Äù Self was WRONG. Every time I tried to use it it was denied. Come to find out the address I changed changed NOTHING. Still had my old billing address. So I chat them up and am like ‚Äúyo, it doesn‚Äôt work. My address is apparently wrong.‚Äù They tell me ‚Äúwell all you changed was your shipping address. You need to change your actual address.‚Äù For which I had to send a picture of a bill in my name at the new address. Absurd, but whatever. I send this picture and the person tells me it‚Äôs all taken care of. 

I try to use my card with the updated address a couple days later. It‚Äôs denied because the address is wrong. So this time I call them and inform then the information is wrong STILL and THIS TIME I‚Äôm told that it‚Äôs because my ‚Äúpassport address‚Äù is wrong, now I don‚Äôt know about you but when you look at a passport the address isn‚Äôt on there. So what that means is anyone‚Äôs guess. 

Anyway, they tell me I have to send in a picture of my license and that I‚Äôll be contacted back with an update.

A week passes and I hear nothing. So I have to reach out to hem for the 5TH TIME ABOUT THIS SAME ISSUE only to be told that it‚Äôs already been taken care of. Fun fact, when a change is made to your account you get an email explaining said change. I was told on my chat that it‚Äôs already been changed but I‚Äôd received NO confirmation. Suspiciously after the chat, about an hour passes then I get an email stating that the address info has been changed. 

So they CLEARLY have no idea what they‚Äôre doing.

Next order of business is the features. This new bank launched in the US market with little to NO understanding of the market itself. Mobile payment options in the US are on the rise yet they launched without support for Apple Pay or Zelle or Cash App or Venmo or basically anything used int he 21 century save PayPal. They do offer ACH transfers through PayPal and CashApp and I was able to add my account and routing number to Apple Pay but that‚Äôs ACH. It takes days. And for an institution that prides itself on being the modern banking solution to use such antiquated standards and ONLY those standards is absolutely unacceptable. 

I‚Äôve had NOTHING but strife with this company. I chalk a portion of it up to the fact that they‚Äôre in unknown territory but there‚Äôs no excuse for the terrible service, asinine backwards policies that prevent individuals from being able to manage their accounts, and lack of basic support structure when it‚Äôs needed. 

N26 has reinvented banking only by managing to dispense of all the old terrible trappings of old banks and replacing them with new ones. 

Bottom Line:

Until this institution gets it together, go with Simple instead.

This is a review of the app, not the bank. 

In general the app looks nice and is easy to use. It doesn‚Äôt get in your way. That‚Äôs good. 

I‚Äôve been experiencing the same bugs in the app for months and there‚Äôs no way to report a bug in the app, so I‚Äôll enumerate them here:

* Foreign currency transfers: currency dropdown just doesn‚Äôt work and crashes the view. It‚Äôs been like this for a year or more. 
* When foreign currency transfer did work, saving a USD recipient didn‚Äôt actually save them. Never worked. 
* I‚Äôve had a duplicate outbound transfer ‚Äúwaiting for confirmation‚Äù for over half a year. Can‚Äôt delete it. Can‚Äôt confirm it. Uninstalling/reinstalling the app doesn‚Äôt fix it. Called the bank and they have no idea. 
* Sessions: buggy. I get ‚ÄúSession expired‚Äù messages far too often. If I‚Äôm lucky I‚Äôll stay logged in for a few days before getting that message. Touch ID is hardly worth it when I‚Äôm having to authenticate with a password so often. 
* Formatting: when sending a transfer and the decimal amount ends in zero, the last decimal is missing on the confirmation screen. e.g ‚Ç¨19.70 will show as ‚Ç¨19.7

The app needs to show you how much you have spent in a day and month in total. Right now it shows you the average per month since inception of your account. 

It is unintuitive and difficult for you to manually add it up. It‚Äôs a simple feature that most rival challenger banks such as revolut and monzo have. It‚Äôs unbelievable that this simple feature has escaped N26 so far. This should be done for both the iOS and android versions and the user interface should be consistent across both platforms. Right now it takes a bit of time and effort to find the identical features on android. 

Please please implement and fix this soon.

I think y‚Äôall are getting gun shy which is the reason for the many delays into the US market. You officially announced and retracted multiple times. Americans are also super wary of things that seem like a ‚Äúscam‚Äù and the recent press about money laundering and bad customer service could be the tipping point. I honestly want for N26 to work out but my outlook on it is grim. I have been using fintech banks since ‚Äò14 starting with simple and now have chime and Empower. I left a review last year listing the reasons why I couldn‚Äôt make Monzo my main bank - the evolution in the time since then has been fantastic. I‚Äôve finally stopped treating Monzo like a prepaid card and it‚Äôs now my main current account and the central place to go for all of my financial info.
Monzo Plus features are well worth the monthly ¬£5 in my opinion.
Looking forward to seeing the Budget section get a revamp, it doesn‚Äôt update the view unless you go out and back in, there‚Äôs no batch updating which can be tedious, there‚Äôs no immediately obvious category view (this is available in the transaction search) or month on month comparison. I‚Äôm still trying to find a budget solution that lets me better understand where my larger, less frequent transactions are - holidays, annual insurances, car tax etc. all throw off monthly views as they are anomalies (and so I typically exclude them as I want a meaningful comparison month on month). Understanding the true full cost of something would also be nice, for example - when going on holiday or planning an event there are numerous things (in various categories) that factor in to the cost over significant periods of time, nearly like a shared tab but without having to share it with anyone.
Custom categories and splitting transactions are a great additions, I‚Äôve been able to split credit card payments into real categories for better understanding.

Don‚Äôt usually leave reviews however this app has made mobile banking awesome. I love getting notifications with every payment I make (online and in-store). I found that the most effective feature I use is that it shows how much money you have but then it also shows the money you have left with your future payments coming out so you know exactly how much you have to actually spend rather than always working it out like my old bank. Everything is so clear and simple. Although I absolutely love this bank I‚Äôm not gonna reduce the stars for a minor issue: I understand when making an online purchase or paying something store things the app requires you to approve it via the app. Never had a problem apart from one time I was making a purchase and when I went to authorise it actually didn‚Äôt go through properly. The payment came out of my bank but they didn‚Äôt receive it through the other side even though they could see a payment was made. They noticed there was a payment issue and I think it might of been the authorisation when coming in and out of the apps via mobile apps. Anyhow, monzo have been good to me and contacted me through their online chat and I contacted the other company where the payment will be reversed which I‚Äôm currently waiting on. Super friendly, like talking to a normal person. Because of that I‚Äôll keep it as 5 stars.

I‚Äôve been using my monzo for a year now and the number of features that come with it- the ability to easily send and receive money, split bills, save your pennies in your coin jar, and set up a variety of different pots so you can organise your money. There‚Äôs also a variety of decent savings options. 
In particular I‚Äôve found that Monzo give you the best rates abroad that I‚Äôve only ever found on a Credit Card before so it‚Äôs fantastic to be able to use your everyday Debit card abroad without having to worry. I‚Äôve often found that my Monzo has much better rates than any cash exchanges so I don‚Äôt bother much to get cash out these days.
I only have one criticism my Monzo card. I think the app is too easy to open on my smartphone with no security in comparison to my other banking apps. There is no fingerprint recognition and no password, this is the only thing that makes me hesitant to put more money in this account as I worry the app isn‚Äôt as secure if I were to loose my phone vs other banking apps.

Otherwise I‚Äôd always recommend a Monzo account, they‚Äôre brilliant.

Great, quick app and it has some extremely useful features such as budgeting, the ability to freeze your card if you misplace it and excellent customer support, after a recent large purchase which would have taken me over the maximum card limit, a few chat messages later and they increased the limit for me. They also sent me a statement needed for an application which arrived the next working day. Push notifications never miss and they send you a spending report at the end of the month too. It really is a great alternative to the mainstream banks                                       ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è 

In terms of improvements for the future I‚Äôd like to see the ability to have the app available on more than one device at a time and have an iPad specific app. The ability to pay in for free at a post office would be much more convenient too rather than relying on chargeable PayPoint which failed twice when I tried to pay cash in, instead I had to pay in to a Santander account at the Post Office and transfer it over. Also the ability to pay cheques in through the app (like Lloyd‚Äôs), especially when Monzo are a digital, app based bank. It seems very old fashioned, time consuming and insecure posting them off.

I don‚Äôt often leave reviews for apps but Monzo has changed the way I bank/save. Immediate notifications on spends and the ability to add notes and receipts on each transaction works brilliantly. After spending for a short time you have the ability to search and filter on particular transactions to determine how much you‚Äôve spent and average spend. Set up payees and send money is simple and quick. Saving pots are easy to set up and I find it great to keep savings separate. The coin jar is a great feature (rounding up each transaction to the nearest pound) for saving little bits at a time is brilliant and it builds up quicker than you‚Äôd expect. I know some people moan about Apple Pay being missing but I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll come soon which will then make the experience even better. I started using Monzo just over a year ago and I‚Äôve since made it my main account including all my direct debits and have my salary paid in. It‚Äôs always improving and am excited to see how it develops in the near future. If you‚Äôre thinking of joining I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

This is the first time I have ever written a review for an app. However, I felt compelled because of how much I love Monzo. This app is great. Recently acquired it, mainly for the budgeting feature, which works great. I was surprised though at how many other great features there are, especially the little ‚Äúpots‚Äù you can set up, but you don‚Äôt have to ‚Äúfaff‚Äù about opening up separate accounts because they all come under the umbrella of the one account. Last night, I ordered a pizza online and to my surprise I was directed to the app, just to confirm that this payment was from me, which I really liked. I have used the app, through Apple Pay, abroad and it works really well and has the advantage of no fees!! Brilliant!! Finally, the other feature I like is the fact that it incorporates the ‚Äúspare change‚Äù option! It‚Äôs like it is 1 app that in the past you have had to have several for to get the functionality that you want! Thanks again Monzo for designing this product, keep up the good work! The only regret - not finding out about it earlier!!

Modern banking, you wouldn‚Äôt think it was a real bank account. You can set a profile picture, categorise your expenditures, set emojis, instantly see your incomings and outgoings as and when they happen, send people money along with messages and emojis, easily split the bill cost with other Monzo users, etc. My favourite feature is the ability to easily create savings pots, which you then have the option to ‚Äòlock‚Äô until a certain date, and the option to activate a feature that rounds up all of your outgoing payments and puts the rounded up pennies into the savings pot, so you save without even knowing it, and cannot sneakily break into the savings until the set date (or by contacting Monzo if you urgently need it). I also got a few people to join by the offer to give them ¬£10 for joining, this app is definitely up and coming!

I just realised I completely overlooked its main feature of fee-free spending abroad too. This card is basically a perfect all-rounder and could be used as a main /only bank account:

Getting my first bank account in the UK as an EU national was hell. I gave them my ID, they wanted a passport, then they wanted my driving license, then a letter from this institution, the from that, etc. Towards the end of the process, I was expecting them to demand a vial of my blood, one of my kidneys, and my firstborn child. Getting my first Monzo account was a delightful experience and I keep getting astonished at how easy they make doing things that in the past would require me to take time off work to go to a branch with my old bank. I started using Monzo with caution, only keeping <¬£100 in the account. Today, I made the full switch and am looking forward to using the budgeting and the automated saving capabilities of the app to their fullest. Also, from all the newsletters I get, the Monzo one is probably the only one I read and the content on the website is actually helpful. I wish Monzo a lot of growth, global expansion and stability. Please consider ‚Äúdigital nomading‚Äù as a use case (e.g. researchers, entrepreneurs, freelancers) if you have not already!

Have been using Monzo for over a year and have been very happy with it and the service.  My main use is abroad on holiday.  Being able to withdraw cash from ATMs without costly charges up to a certain limit.  But great when shopping especially supermarkets....however this may not be so easy as sometimes you go to pay and you haven‚Äôt got enough cash on the card but you could while standing at the checkout whip out your phone and transfer some money from your linked bank account through the debit card that‚Äôs linked.  However this service is coming to an end.... I know it‚Äôs cost related but standing in a check out queue trying to get on your online banking app to transfer money over is a lengthy process and people in check outs don‚Äôt like any hold ups.  Basically it‚Äôs a great shame that this process is being stopped as it was invaluable in an emergency.  Ah well all good things come to an end....just have to be more on it when it comes to holiday cash.

I was really enjoying this card until I suddenly found I could no longer load it to then use. What‚Äôs even worse is the 180 day period starts from when you hit the limit so it‚Äôs not really a six month limit at all but six months from when you find yourself without it. Starling has none of these limits,so takes top spot for me. Otherwise it‚Äôs a nice app and card,Apple Pay works etc. They have a license so should be covered under section 75. I‚Äôll keep Monzo for saving but it‚Äôs now at the back of my wallet. Please lift the load limits,I‚Äôd not be shocked if kids with rooster cards load more than me...
Lost my starling card so forced back here only to find you have removed the top up from another card method of adding funds. Starling is so much better for an everyday card as it has no silly load limits and can be used at post offices to top up - I think pay point use is coming. Initially this was excellent til I hit that limit. Now hoping it‚Äôs been a year and that I get a new starling card ASAP!

I‚Äôve been a Monzo customer for nearly a year now and generally use the account as my personal spending account to limit my monthly spending and help save.  The ability to round up to the next pound and pop some extra pennies into a savings pot is great and it builds up nicely. I know other banks can do this too...BUT... the main reason for such a positive review because I have recently been a victim of a fraud and scam case with the other bank I use. As my other accounts were linked to Monzo, I was totally duped me out of thousands of pounds, I can‚Äôt thank Monzo enough for the help and support they gave me as this scam was very elaborate, involving spoofing my other bank‚Äôs phone number and even infiltrating their text chain too. They are working in conjunction with the other bank and police to trace the criminals‚Äô accounts and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the support and kindness they showed me. The other bank have sorted things their end too.

Per the title I really like Monzo.  The app is well thought out and the notifications of each spend are great. 
Two minor issues... First, the widget doesn‚Äôt seem to refresh so I have to click on it to go into the app then wait for the app balance to refresh before the widget will refresh.  In contrast my Santander widget automatically refreshes and also has a refresh click button on the widget to do that if all else fails. 
Second issue is as others have reported the card periodically declines and you have to go into the app to re-authorise yourself. I find that quite ridiculous and embarrassing when sat there and my card declines. I would understand if it did this for large purchases (or you could even allow the user to set a purchase limit requiring touch ID authentication..) but this can be inconvenient especially if, like some family members, you like to leave your phone at home when going out for a meal together!

I‚Äôd been using other banking apps for a while including one purporting to offer similar features when I decided to try out Monzo as an extra account a few months ago. Last month is the first month I‚Äôve had my salary paid into Monzo and have been using it more regularly, I absolutely love it! I am in my 40s which shows you don‚Äôt have to be a millennial to love this app üòä The features are brilliant and have helped me know what is happening with my money instantly. I use a separate budget app and the Monzo instant notifications and separate saving pots removing saved money from the left to spend balance has helped with keeping me on top of that as well. I currently pay my regular household direct debits out of a separate account as I have historically found it easier to budget that way and I am seriously considering switching to Monzo completely. Thank you Monzo for introducing something that blows other banks away.

Beware of this banking app, it‚Äôs all nice and smooth sailing from a mobile app user experience point of view but scores zero from a traditional banking point of view. They will freeze your account for weeks without any notice or explanation even when queried. Even worse, they could close your account out of the blues without any explanation whatsoever. The worst part of it is that you don‚Äôt get your money back so I wouldn‚Äôt use this for serious transactions as you can wake up one morning and your money is gone with no explanation whatsoever. And while your account is unknowingly frozen or closed, any payments to the account will bounce without your notice so definitely not good for salary accounts or business accounts as you might receive unexpected payments with endless consequences from a bounce back the account owner is completely unaware of. Quite unfortunate but thankfully they‚Äôve paved the way for other digital banks that would hopefully provide some key traditional banking practices around providing excellent services to customers that entrust their hard earned money for protection.

I‚Äôve been a Monzo customer from the ‚Äòbeta‚Äô days and the growth of the product has been impressive. I was very quick to close any other current accounts and consolidated everything to Monzo leaving it as my sole bank account - and it hasn‚Äôt failed me yet!

The continuous development that goes on - both in terms of app functionality and the products / services offered have meant Monzo are constantly introducing new features and functionality that aren‚Äôt token changes - they‚Äôre useful, value adding changes that can only help drive more and more users to the platform.

Since I joined Monzo in July 2017 - things started good - they‚Äôve only continued to progress.

Interest earning saving pots, it‚Äôs fantastic budgeting tools and the (great) updated UI are just a few of the great feature I‚Äôve seen added in that time.

Keep it up Monzo! And if you‚Äôre a customer - make sure you sign up for their email updates. I wouldn‚Äôt say that for any other product or service I use - but Monzo only ever seem to have good news.

Great example would be their comms regarding the changes due to SCA regulations. Monzo were clearly well prepared for the changes and informed users quickly and clearly.

These guys know what they‚Äôre doing - and I can see them being an even more disruptive business as they continue to grow and expand their services.

Great app, great concept. The main reason I got a Monzo account was so that I could keep track of my disposable income spending. I love how this account gives you instant notifications for spending instead of having to wait 3+ days for transactions to appear on your normal current account. However, still annoying with buying petrol as the total amount left doesn‚Äôt show for a few days.  Glad that simple things like changing your contact details can now be done via the app, as I had to do this via the chat facility. Sometimes unfortunately this app has been slow to catch up with spending (petrol transactions for some reason) so not going to rate this 5 star yet unfortunately as definitely room for improvement. Also, the last few weeks, Monzo has been really slow to update when opening the app therefore not showing you correct amounts.

We all know that every little transaction adds up. Monzos app allows you to keep track of these expenses better than any bank I've seen. It categories all of your spending and shows if and where you're slowly haemorrhaging money. You can set budgets for your food shop and eating out. Those little trips to the shop where you spend a few pounds at a time is very trackable with Monzo and helps curtail your spending. The security is amazing too: You can freeze and unfreeze your card with the touch of a button, turn off contactless and have access to live chat with helpful staff. Sharing money has never been easier too, monzo provides links to request specific a mounts of money from people that you can share in chat groups ect which is super handy if everyone needs to give you a few pounds each, it's easier for them than going through a transfer process. Monzo is must have!

I acquired the Monzo card last year for a trip to Turkey and all withdrawals transactions were a breeze. As soon as I got back to the hotel and picked up WiFi all the transaction notifications appeared. Great for abroad travel, highly recommend.

Since then I now use this card as a secondary account and as my main card for day to day transactions, topping up as I need. The benefits are, I always know when money is going out with instant notifications (sometimes quicker than receiving the receipt from the checkout). My normal food and fuel debit transactions with a well known high street bank sometimes don‚Äôt appear for days... not the case with Monzo. It‚Äôs so much easier to track your usage. 

One thing that I love is the freeze and unfreezing feature in the App. If I can‚Äôt find my card, one tap of a button and it can‚Äôt be used, when I find it, another tap of a button and hey presto, back in action.

Account closed. The first issue I had was that for no good reason the app was saying my balance was reducing by ¬£3 in approx 4 days I removed my balance immediately and attempted to contact via chat no one was available to speak to me despite claims of 24 hour chat service. I then got a message from the friend who gave me a the link saying ‚ÄúMonzo asked me to give you a nudge to use your account and get the free ¬£5.‚Äù I wasn‚Äôt happy at this point that Monzo had told someone else my details and that I hadn‚Äôt used the account. I sent this to the help@monzo email and to this point 12 hours later have still not received any communication from them not even confirmation. I did receive the card after closing the account so thought again and ‚Äúmaybe had been a touch rash‚Äù and thought ‚Äúgive them an opportunity to resolve‚Äù and asked to reinstate my account but so far no contact. Not really a service more a one man operation which as far as I can make out has no responsibility, integrity or ability God help the people using this as their main account. Terrible truly terrible.

Monzo manages to do two things at once; first, design the best app I've seen for managing your spending, and second, build an entirely new banking service around what customers want. I'm forgiving of some of the outstanding issues (like Apple Pay was only recently added to the banking service) but the team are as transparent as they can be on what services they are going to build next. If you want an app that will simply count your purchases, use another app. If you want a bank that'll exploit your funds and give a rubbish service in return, bank with someone else. But if you want a bank that feels like a partnership, use Monzo. Keep going, Monzonauts!

As promised, I've edited my previous review which shows that Monzo really do care about keeping customers happy (can't be said of all app developers, let alone banks).

I used to spend blindly and worry about my overdraft later - then I made Monzo my main current account and everything changed. How many apps or bank accounts can you truly describe as life saving? I would think not many. Monzo is one of those however as they save some amazing features that are great for people who struggle with their money management:-

1) If you have a gambling issue they can block your card being used at bookies/casino/online sites. This has stopped me gambling completely and I feel so much better!

2) I hear you saying that you can still withdraw cash and gamble? Actually no as they have limited my cash withdrawals to ¬£20 a day! Enough to get a hair cut or car wash but not enough to do serious issues with gambling.

3) The locked pots feature is great! My only niggle with these is they can be easily unlocked. I wish they would force you into a conversation with customer service like they do with the gambling bars.

4) You see everything going on with your account at least a day before. Outgoing and incoming payments are listed the day before or a few days if a weekend. This is great if you need to transfer money to cover payments.

5) Get paid early! You get paid a day early if you want! Not a huge thing but if you get paid on a Monday, you can get it Friday!

6) Their customer service is amazing! Some truly caring and helpful people. They will massively go out of their way for you!

Thanks Monzo üòÅ

I was not happy that I got charged for paying money into my account. I assume that if it is current/debit account, there should not be a chargeable fee for that. This is considering the fact that Monzo does not have a branch for such transactions.

I never leave reviews, In fact I think this is the first one I have ever write but this bank is honestly the best bank ever! I got scammed 7 days ago and reported it to monzo immediately. They said it would take up to 20 days to potentially recover funds and they recovered 100% percent of the funds in only 7 days! Also if you refund anything on a site the money goes in to your account immediately unlike high street banks that take x amount of working days. If you have a problem on there you can go on to the live chat and someone will answer your within literally 1 minute. If not the helpline answers so quickly aswell and everyone I‚Äôve spoke to has been so friendly. Changing this to my main bank now. So pleased. Thank you monzo!

I‚Äôve been using monzo for about half a year now and it‚Äôs without doubt the best tool out there to manage your short term expenses. I‚Äôve chopped my monthly spending down by ¬£300 a month since switching and have saved all of that into their savings pot (savings account) which gives an acceptable 1% apr. Every user experience you have is always extremely polished and works just as you would expect it to in the current modern world. Send and request money easily to/from non monzo accounts and even better when it‚Äôs monzo to monzo. Splitting the bill at dinner with a group is a breeze and setting budgets to limit your monthly spending is really intuitive and it tells you how you should be doing at any point in the month. 

The only thing monzo isn‚Äôt ready to replace just yet is regular current account for features like depositing money and cheques, they do ha e a solution for it, but it‚Äôs no where near as easy to use as normal banks. 

They even prompted me to change my energy today following a price increase from my energy provider and the experience has been A*

I cannot recommend this product enough to anyone.

A must have in the modern world!

I love the idea of this app bringing banking into the 21st century in contrast to all the regular banks stuck in the older generations; it's comparable to using a Nokia 3210 and replacing it with an iPhone 7. 
It's extremely simple and an absolute pleasure to use giving you live balance figures and a categorised trace of transactions to understand spending habits. 
I've owned this card for less than a day and instantly impressed. I don't even leave reviews so this speaks volumes for how banking should be.
I've left 4 stars which contradicts the above and this is for some minor improvements which may be considered....

1. Apple pay as a form of payment. I love using Apple pay to top up and this avoids using the horrendous banking app and I love it. Surely Apple pay can be a 2-way function like most electronics these days?

2. Facility to add our own pictures to assign to each pot.

3. Edit the order in which the pots are scrolled through. Currently they are fixed in the order they were created.

This app is still worthy of 5 stars as the banking experience is second to none... It'd be great with a little more personalisation though and the ability to leave the house without the card in favour of using Apple pay.

I can honestly say Monzo is setting the standard for how banks should be run! When I first heard about the app I was sceptical, especially because it involved my money, however I couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong! I‚Äôm in the process of slowly switching to Monzo for my main account and would recommend others do too! Since joining I‚Äôve already taken part in a google hangout feedback session and had my opinions listened to and acted upon. In the 20 years I‚Äôve been with my high street bank that has never happened! Monzo is simple, secure and does exactly what it says on the tin, all whilst listening to their users and building a truly wonderful service. This is what the industry has been missing! Love the level of communication, keep up the good work!

I heard about this via the Martin Lewis website prior to visiting American for a one week trip. What an absolutely fantastic option this turned out to be.
- by applying for the card via Martin Lewis site, it was received within 2/3 days, just in time for my holiday (I‚Äôm useless at planning ahead). 
- the top up option is super quick & easy. 
- the instant notification on every penny spent is a fantastic feature, especially when using my card during my trip abroad.
- the tips found throughout the app are really useful and easy to understand. 
- the exchange rate available is brilliant. 

Although the initial plan was to use this for the holiday only, I have decided I will continue using this to help with my spending for future. 

***note for users abroad - some cash machines do charge for withdrawing cash. The first ATM went to charge $5 but I tried another which only charged $3... I made sure I withdrew enough physical cash I needed & then continued to use my card as a regular debit card in shops / restaurants as normal without charges. So just be mindful that you might get stung if the idea is to use it for numerous cash withdrawals which charges are made out of Monzos control. :)

As a young lady who is pretty miserable at saving money this app and bank has honestly opened my eyes! It‚Äôs so great (and daunting) to see where you money is being spent, splitting bills, sending money etc so easily! I love love love Monzo. The only thing I recommend to Monzo developers is, on the Budget it runs from the start and end dates of the month. However, if someone gets paid on the 24th or each month, for example, it throws out my ‚Äúover budget‚Äù because it thinks I still have X amount of days left in the month. If you could change your start date of the month from the day you get paid it would work better üòÑ. You won‚Äôt regret getting a Monzo, it only makes your life easier. The card is a cute colour too.

If I could seriously give this bank 0 stars I really don‚Äôt would. In March-April, Monzo closed my account. This bank closed my account and they NEVER TOLD ME WHY. Now I‚Äôm working two jobs and I have bills to pay. I was using my account like normal, buying things at the groceries or using Uber eats and Justeat at times if I was to exhausted to cook. This was disheartening and disgusting and the organisation should be closed. So many of my friends had also had their accounts closed so I‚Äôm a little relieved about that. But monzo was the only bank I had- I had no back ups. I was left scrambling to look and apply for a new bank. I had to use a prepaid card because banks were rejecting my application left right and center which I thought was weird. I put forward a subject data request on cifas and saw there was a marker on my name. Months down the line I‚Äôm still trying to sort it out. Hopefully I will by the end of the year but BE WARNED they will close your account soon!!

I have been a Monzo customer for 3 years now and have loved the usability, feel and features of this app for some time - but lately it‚Äôs performance has been flaky. It‚Äôs been slow to update my balance (sometimes 10-15 seconds) and sometimes fails to startup at all. Frustrating when push notifications work fine when purchase has been made and you want to check your account in app. It‚Äôs also very annoying when you‚Äôre in a queue about to pay and can‚Äôt quite remember how much you have on your account! I have seen this happen to other people as well (also in the queue ahead!) 
Hope you can address these performance issues, your new features have been great so far :)

I found this app on a money saving website that had mentioned it‚Äôs saving pots that you can lock to a specific date and no online instant access. I thought it was going to be another app like Chip or Plum were is simply saves little bits at a time and use it to save. To my delight it is much more. It‚Äôs now going to be my main current account and the locked saving pots are perfect for saving for birthdays or Christmas. Means I can‚Äôt touch the money until the date I set. I can ring to unlock the funds but as long as you only set aside what you know you can afford it saves you from dipping into the savings for impulse buying. Especially in a day and age were impulsive spending is very easy to do.

I keep this card topped up from my main bank account with one of the big four. It‚Äôs my friendly pot of money when I‚Äôm out & leave my handbag behind, like my gym visits.  I keep it in my mobile phone case as I rarely leave my phone behind. Hubby now has one too, & it‚Äôs been a godsend at times as transferring funds to each other so quickly & simply. I set up a savings pot at Xmas when organising a meal for 30, great for my friends to transfer their payments to me, allowing me to pay super quick at the restaurant. One problem so far was when I withdrew ¬£100  cash & and the ATM didn‚Äôt pay out. My account was debited but the very helpful & pleasant Monzo telephone staff sorted it out (eventually) for me.

I never write reviews but Monzo deserves one. Its totally changed my way of banking! I joined when their card was a pre paid card for travel and was hesitant about joining up as a full on bank account but its the best bank account I have ever had. Everything is instant! I hear that notification on my phone that I have spent money before I have even walked out of the shop. Savings are easily kept aside and budgets set and maintained.
