Absolute convert since switching from Barclays to Monzo. Registration was easy and was set up quickly. I use money very simple - purchases always made by card and I never take out or deposit cash so Monzo was definitely the best choice for me. You receive an instant notification when you spend. I‚Äôve set up a savings account where any money spent is rounded up and the extra change is put in there. I love the layout and the app is very easy to navigate. Switching was made a breeze by Monzo. Needing a physical copy of my statement is not a problem at all as well as I can just pull it up from the app and print myself. Been using Monzo since July 2018 and have had no problem whatsoever. I heard of Monzo through my friend, and thought I would tentatively give it a try... I can honestly say I haven‚Äôt looked back! My regular bank is santander who I ended up with after they absorbed abbey national. I am pretty much going to ditch them and go to monzo fully. At the moment, I pay a lump sum into my acc and use it for day to day expenditure. I have now set up a savings pot as well. The app is brilliant! I think Monzo have got it right.  

My sign-up process took just 10 minutes or so and was completed entirely in-app. I received my approval within half an hour and my very brightly-coloured card was delivered next day. (This card *should* be difficult to mislay!)

With just a few setup/admin tasks to complete including the option to enable an overdraft facility (again all in-app) and I was up and running.

In everyday use, the app suits my needs very well. It‚Äôs looks great and is really easy to use with lots of nice features to enhance your banking without making it complicated.

New transactions are instantly notified on my iPhone and automatically categorised e.g. groceries, entertainment, etc. I have  also setup a monthly budgets for the categories. The app will alert me how much I have left in my budget each time I make a new transaction. This really should make it easier to manage my money.

The banking service itself offers all the features I need (currently) such as no fees when using the card in the UK, no fees for bank transfers and no fees when spending using the card abroad.

I'm slowly switching to monzo as my primary account as Barclays is behind the times! In monzo I get to see my spending habits and track my loans and pay off early with no fees (in fact you also get charged less interest for paying earlier!)

Also for some reason whenever I switch to my 'bills' pot, the app crashes every time. Don't even ask me how to subscribe to the Monzo supporter program anymore either, I can't find it anywhere since the new UI happened.

I hope these issues will be addressed in time (I know they will). Until then my wife and I will continue to hobble along somehow.

I was a little sceptical to begin with, as I‚Äôve always stuck with ‚Äòmainstream‚Äô banks - so the security of Monzo initially raised some questions! (I‚Äôve now discovered there‚Äôs nothing to worry about! Security checks are required throughout for various activities and without your thumb print you‚Äôre not getting in!) 

I‚Äôm a student an uni and this app was popping up everywhere to encourage students to budget and start saving some money! I decided to give it ago by using it as a pocket money account whilst keeping my other bank account for standing orders and direct debits.

Within days I realised this app was amazing! I recommend this app to everyone! Thanks to Monzo I‚Äôll be booking a fantastic holiday this year, which not all uni students can say üôà

I never leave reviews, but honestly this app is amazing!

To be honest, this is the best bank I‚Äôve ever been with. It has changed my life! The debit card is simple and snazzy, the app is clean, smooth and so easy to navigate and use. And in general, I would recommend the bank to anyone. I ever crossed paths with! - Also as I‚Äôm in college, it helps me with budgeting and keeps track of my ridiculous amounts of online and in person spending! A game-changer when it comes to managing personal finances and ease of use, I‚Äôd never go back to the old ways. Way to go Monzo, just don‚Äôt rest on your laurels now and refine those features, they‚Äôre almost there but not quite yet.

I‚Äôve had this account for a few months now and am very impressed. So many excellent features and instant updates mean I‚Äôve felt much clearer about what I actually have to spend than ever before! My account has been frozen for over a month for no reason and when I tried contacting Monzo via phone to know why my account with them was frozen, call failed.I realized they blocked my number from calling them. I tried chatting to them via their app and the guy was like ‚Äúyour account has been frozen we are investigating‚Äù and immediately blocked me from chatting to them in future. what kind of bank freeze your account and not contacting you as to why your account is been frozen. I regret banking Monzo and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend Monzo in any way because they are not reliable and customer service is ZERO. This was my my experience with Monzo and I‚Äôve read similar problems. I saw the Monzo adverts on tv and thought it would be worth a try, I decided to sign up and after about 10 minutes it was all set and I had a Monzo account, the card came in two days even though the sign up said expect it to take a week, overall I‚Äôm 100% happy with the account, using pay points to put money in is so easy, and the ¬£1 fee isn‚Äôt too bad. It‚Äôs so easy to open a bank account with them not like going in to a high street bank with their million and one questions, in my opinion everyone should have one, thanks Monzo

So I steered clear of Monzo for a while as I didn‚Äôt really trust the brand. However, I switched current accounts and realised that my new bank had very few features in its app. I‚Äôm using Monzo for my everyday spending with the other current account for direct debits and bills. I love how quick and responsive the activity is in Monzo. By contrast, other banks can take several days to update one‚Äôs available balance! I love the budget reports and the little line that tells you how much you‚Äôve spent and how long to go until your next cash injection. I love the new layout. Many don‚Äôt. But I think it is much better and the structure is a lot more navigable.

Suggestion for devs: Swap the budget button with the help button.

I frequently read glowing reports about this app. Is it all hype? Have been an early adopter of fintech but use a competitor as my daily driver, smart phone only primary bank account. 
I can honestly say M is big on self promotion, their fan base is apparently about the age of my youngest child, a self-regarding millennial.
But why other than to be cool and contemporary (a just perhaps controversial) would anyone put their trust or money here? Japan‚Äôs 7 Eleven chain store brought out a smartphone app payment service for their customers convenience a few months ago. One day (!) after its launch scammers purloined $500,000,000 and showed the software/accounts back office was so porous the chain had to refund their customers losses and closed down the 7Pay scheme. Not very Japanese, not Shinkansen. And they didn‚Äôt ( so far as we know) store their customers credentials in log files for their engineers.
In short, don‚Äôt.

I‚Äôve noticed that you can now unlock your pots yourself within the app and must then ask what is the point of having such a pot? The idea worked great because it‚Äôs a hastle having to call someone to access your money but can access it if you desperately need to do so and so by and large you really do start to save money. However I‚Äôve just tested how easy it is to now get your money, it‚Äôs a bit disappointing as well as confusing as to why have this feature anymore? That extra ‚Äòfriction‚Äô won‚Äôt really stop people from dipping into the pot. Which seems pointless because the idea is to remove that friction. Just wanted to suggest in the future perhaps setting a level of stringency as to how difficult users want to make it to access their money. :)

Monzo completely changed my view on banking... making it so easy to track my spending, incredible customer support (the chat feature made me fall in love with monzo and start to use it as my only bank account!), I travel frequently so the spending abroad is awesome, the instant notifications have me bragging about my bank every time I use my card, the money pots just made life easier and basically just had the best experience possible from a bank ever!!! I work with banks in the UK creating promotional content and sharing there features, but have never been excited about any of here products even if it pays the bills, MONZO on the other hand - SUPER HYPED!

In this day and age, where there are a load of online scammers around, monzo make it so easy to ensure your money doesn‚Äôt go anywhere you don‚Äôt want it to.  I recently, very stupidly, bought a K√•rken bag though a fake website advertised on Facebook! I know how stupid! But, it said 50% off for a bag that is usually ¬£80+ so I jumped at the chance.

Anyway, I realised my stupidity after placing my order.  Distraught and looking for a way to get a refund I realised that in the monzo bank app you can ‚Äúquestion your payment‚Äù, if it‚Äôs recent purchase you can stop the transaction from happening and get your money back! So simple.  

Thanks Monzo keep doing what you are doing!

I used to love this bank for all the reason most people do but when I got scammed I stopped trusting this bank straight away the reason is because I was scammed over the phone they have used the banks number, they knew all my details where i lived and everything when I explained that to the bank first thing they said was ‚Äú oh no not again it‚Äôs being happening all day‚Äù I was absolutely in shock what kind of bank allows that they then proceeded to tell me I would get my money back in 2 weeks once again it was a lie it took them 2 months only for them to tell me I dint take enough caution to verify if it really was the bank calling me basically telling me it‚Äôs my own fault I‚Äôm really disappointed with this bank and I hope this doesn‚Äôt happened to anyone else it‚Äôs actually very shady the way the run this ‚Äúbank‚Äù it‚Äôs literally o scam I‚Äôm just sorry I fell for it not impressed at all.

I love using Monzo, but one problem I always seem to have when I‚Äôm away is that it‚Äôs very difficult  to transfer money when I‚Äôm off-line.
If there is any way that Monzo could have a look at this particular issue it would be fantastic both I‚Äôm sure for me and for many other people?
Otherwise it‚Äôs an amazing piece of kit. You always advise us when money has been taken from your account which could be extremely useful if somebody got hold of your card unlawfully?

So congratulations to you guys at Monzo for all your hard work it really is appreciated.

This bank is so quick and easy to set up compared to setting up a new bank account with a normal bank, it takes no more than 10 minutes. Banking with monzo is simple so is perfect for any ages, it is all done through one app which is ideal and convenient. It is modern and amazingly easy to do anything and everything you need. Highly recommend this bank for anyone and everyone

Where do I even start,
As someone who works within the banking industry, it seems almost blasphemous to be complimenting another bank. But I‚Äôm not just complimenting them, they are without a doubt the best bank I have ever been with. 
From a slick and effective banking app which provides people more control and knowledge of what they can do with their finances, to a customer service chat which resolves problems no matter how big or small in easily a few messages. Monzo is by far the leading bank for innovation and customer focus. 
There are no tricks, no smoke and mirrors, just an absolutely outstanding service which exceeded my expectations and more.

Always used high street banks and didn‚Äôt know what I was missing out on! Opened this account after hearing very positive things and I‚Äôm blown away. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this online bank enough, I can‚Äôt wait to change everything over and get paid a day early! I sent 10 pound from my sports betting account last night to test out how long it took to clear. It was in within 4 hours, in comparison to any other bank I‚Äôve used it takes 2-5 days so this is absolutely ground breaking, seriously. The app is set out perfectly and has more information on transactions and accounts than any other app I‚Äôve used. Keep up the good work.

There‚Äôs a lot of digital banks out there but I‚Äôve had Monzo for three years now and they are fantastic.  Ideal for folk who are just wanting a more modern  bank. Their chat service is useful and efficient. I was scammed via PayPal and they managed to successfully recover my stolen funds with great support. 

Their overdraft options and buffer are very fair and clearly defined so you really don‚Äôt get caught out with any unexpected bills. Using the card abroad is great too bc there‚Äôs no charges for the exchange rate. 

The IFFT saving penny scheme is amazing also   (itll cover my Christmas shopping this year and I barely notice the missing funds). Additionally the pots are ideal for saving too and I like how customisable they are.

Monzo really is amazing and has changed the way that I bank! I no longer have to obsess constantly about where my money has gone as Monzo has it for me. However I think it should definitely have more categories or sub categories as sometimes the information is inaccurate. As for the newest update, however, I don‚Äôt like it. For me one of the most useful features of the old format was the ability to scroll back and see not only what I had spent but what my balance was, and the graph mapping out where my money was going. The newest update doesn‚Äôt have this and I seriously want it back as it was one of my favourite features.

I absolutely love Monzo and everything about it, I recommend it to many people. It is easy to use, the features are useful and I love seeing instant notifications about everything, including active card checks, that is really useful to know where my card is registered! 

The issues I am seeing regularly however are with the app performance, and a few of my friends have the same issues, it has a few bugs that need ironing out... 

1. When pressing on things they take forever to load at times, and some times don‚Äôt load at all and you have to restart the app once maybe twice to get it to load the page/section you want to see. This isn‚Äôt very good for a modern app and I have an iPhone X (latest iOS) with no performance issues with any other apps. The UX is beautiful however, just need to look at the performance in my opinion.

2. Intermittently, it will show that I have no contacts at all, and then another time it will say I have 200+ which is random.

3. Not a huge issue, but some days it will tell me if I share with friends they get ¬£10, and some days they get ¬£5, is it meant to be this way or is it a bug?

Happily say this is the best bank I‚Äôve used. I like the new recent feature introduced which rounds up your purchases to the nearest pound to which then goes in a pot. It‚Äôs a great way to save without actually thinking about doing it as it does it for you. The response from customer services on issues or enquiries is rapid and are always on hand to reply within hours if non emergency or in an emergency within minutes. It beats sitting on hold for hours to your high street bank to then speak to a robot. With the card contactless it‚Äôs easy to use on holidays with the ¬£200 free withdrawals which is great plus you get the benefits of tap and pay with the contactless feature.

Simple, clear, transparent and very efficient. 

The ability to tag transactions and add to categories makes budgeting very simple, I like the visualisation of your spend and that you can set limits for categories such as ‚Äúeating out‚Äù or ‚Äúentertainment‚Äù. 

Company logos next to the transactions is a nice touch, and also adds a degree of accessibility. 

Monzo to Monzo payments are easy and instant, you can pay via a message or even using airdrop, the app will also make a point of telling you which of your contacts are also on Monzo, it‚Äôs definitely a progressive crowd using this new mobile banking product. 

I also love the unprecedented control you are given over your card: freeze card, cancel card, reveal pin, activate mag strip, set atm withdrawal limit, no more long waits on hold for debit card services!

But the best feature is when you turn on notifications. Make a payment with your debit card and get a notification of your transaction before the chip and pin machine has even said ‚Äúapproved‚Äù!! You also get a nice little ‚Äúmoney jingle‚Äù sound.

I am recommending this app to everyone I know. Even store assistants who comment on the colour of the card (which is awesome). After getting into trouble with credit cards and loans a few years back I couldn‚Äôt get a normal debit card account from a high street bank, they would only offer me cash cards, not a lot of use to a mum of 4 who likes to do the grocery shop online. So I decided to try Monzo after seeing the adds and I‚Äôm so glad I did. Now not only do I have a debit card again but I can easily keep on track of my spending and tuck money away for big bills I know are coming. Thank you Monzo, you‚Äôve given me back my financial life!

I honestly cannot rate Monzo highly enough.
Opening an account with Monzo and moving everything to it has been the single best financial decision I‚Äôve made to date. The app has worked flawlessly since day one. Their support staff are always on hand in chat and the pots & budgeting features have helped me rediscover money I didn‚Äôt know I had. In short order I‚Äôve been able to save and pay off my loans & credit card and the integration with IFTTT is rock solid.
If you‚Äôre on the fence about opening an account, don‚Äôt be! Try it out, you won‚Äôt be disappointed! It‚Äôs a pleasure to bank with Monzo and I‚Äôd recommend them to anyone in a heartbeat.

I downloaded this app as my girlfriend keeps raving about it! Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get the ¬£5 bonus as if already signed up with an email even though I‚Äôd not gone through verification etc. Nevertheless, I‚Äôm now pretty used to the features you have and it‚Äôs an easy, transparent and slick app.

- Referral bonus for all: a few have got it, and I‚Äôve referred many people in the past. Open it up!

- Regular saver pots: taken from my First Direct account, I can save up to ¬£3,600 a year at 5% interest on the condition that I put no more than ¬£300 a month in, and I don‚Äôt touch it until it matures. Just an idea. üòâ

Banked with monzo for the last two years, using it as my main personal and joint account. Generally very happy, enough to be an investor. 

However, the new app design is a step backward. Whilst the previous app wasn‚Äôt ideal (settings/management options stored in about 3 different places), it was at least more explicit about how you could navigate. 

With the new app there are a lack of signifiers (tap home repeatedly to switch between accounts??) and over reliance on swiping through carousels. As an example, If I want to transfer money from my personal account to someone, I first have to select that on home, and then go to the transfer tab. This feels like a classic of designers feeling overly pleased with their concept and not actually empathising with users who don‚Äôt fit their own personal usage pattern. I want my bank app to be logical, not a recreation of Instagram. 

Added to all this, what was previously a stable and slick app is now less responsive and prone to freezing/crashing. I appreciate the growing pains of transitioning from a startup to mature bank, but this feels like Monzo have taken the eye off the ball.

If you are a student and don‚Äôt have a Monzo account yet - you should! The app has so many features such as the easy freeze and unfreeze option if you lose your card, and ordering a new card is fast and painless unlike other banks. I love the saving pots, that allow me to save for certain things and hit goals as well as the pennies pot which collects all my leftover pennies when I make a transaction - which honestly adds up more quickly than you think. Customer Service are also great, just send them a message through the app, asking literally any questions you might have and they answer you without no fuss at all. So handy when I even have the slightest doubt about any of my transactions or need any help. 
I have no faults with this bank and will continue to love and use it! Some minor things I would like to suggest are: 
‚Ä¢Budgets: I would love to be able to customise my own categories, for example there is an ‚ÄúEating Out‚Äù category but I would love to have a separate budget for say ‚ÄúCoffee‚Äù or ‚ÄúTakeaways‚Äù ‚ÄúPetrol‚Äù or 
‚ÄúNights Out.‚Äù I‚Äôm sure lots of people would love to customise their categories to suit them to! 
‚Ä¢Locked Pots: While you can lock pots for a certain date, it would be more beneficial for me to lock pots until I hit the target rather than a specific date. I feel like both options should be available.

Either you send your request in a text (with no proof but the message that will inevitably be buried in the rest of a conversation), or in some cases the request will appear with the rest of your spending (but again, if you don‚Äôt repay the person right away, it might get buried in your other transactions). De enige reden dat bunq investeert, in staatsobligaties, is omdat ze dit moeten van De Nederlandsche Bank. Anders kregen ze geen banklicentie. Ze investeren nu het minimale en komen daarbij heel dicht in de buurt van een zogeheten Full Reserve Bank. Aangezien de Deposito bank voorlopig op zich laat wachten, is bunq nu het beste alternatief.

Het is alleen w√©l een commerci√´le bank en dat is te zien aan de prijs. Alleen voor een bank die g√©√©n krediet verleent, zoals hypotheken, is deze juist meer dan te rechtvaardigen. Tenslotte verdient bunq dus geen geld met geld.

Daarnaast is bunq onafhankelijk, verkoopt je gegevens niet, loopt voorop qua betalingsmogelijkheden en is de ondersteuning snel, adequaat en persoonlijk.

Een bank oprichten is √©√©n ding.
Maar vervolgens weigeren om geld te scheppen zoals alle andere banken doen is een ander.
Daarom zeg ik, als Geld Filosoof, dat bunq de meest ethische commerci√´le bank (van Nederland) is.

Hier nog een paar opsommingen van problemen die ik ben tegen gekomen:

I've enjoyed the four and a half years I've been with bunq. I've actually been with bunq since the very beginning when bunq became available to the public. All updates so far have been great improvements. But the V3 update is just terrible.

Unfortunately, the update is not the only thing that's terrible today. Lots of other bunq users have provided helpful, insightful, constructive feedback over the last few months. Users who love bunq, who are involved with the community, users who want bunq to succeed. The feedback comes from deep within their hearts, out of a place of love.

Bunq is continually saying they value all feedback, but how can this be true? They have completely ignored almost all of the feedback that has been given, and even removed it from public view! Even problems that were in plain sight during the Update 14 livestream are still present and not corrected! Meanwhile, the only comments that bunq responds to are those that pretend that everything is fine and nothing is wrong.

I loved the bunq of the past that actually made banking easy, and took every user seriously. I loved the bunq of the past that made a great banking service along with a terrific banking app. I don't love the bunq of today that makes an extremely messy UI and presents it as a major improvement. I don't love the bunq of today that shuns all feedback of their loyal users.

The recent behavior of bunq breaks my heart. Unfortunately, this means goodbye for me. I‚Äôm moving my business to a bank I can in fact trust and rely on.

After enjoying bunq for free as an extra account for about a year, I completely switched to bunq in May and chose the Supergreen plan. (I totally understand a bank has to make money, so wasn‚Äôt surprised to see bunq free disappear at some point). It took me quite some time to completely switch and get my bunq sub accounts configured to my liking, but pleased with the result of having subaccounts for all my budgets, having a Maestro card and MasterCard that could be easily switched between accounts and have my salary automatically divided between all subaccounts. 

Back then, the app was incredibly useful to quickly switch cards between accounts when needed, the recent transactions (to track and tag expenses and easily monitor authorised and scheduled payments as well) and the sub accounts (to quickly check if I still have a budget for a possible purchase). The simple tree counter was also nice, and not obtrusive. Also, the app never failed.

Then Update 14 happened, and all of that great UI went down the drain. The three most important features (Accounts, Cards and Events) were now more taps away as they had to make room for bunq‚Äô lifestyle instagram feed. There are massive inconsistencies in the UI, where bunq recently even had to put up a blog with explainer-videos to help users find the essential banking features again. Some features are tucked away under the (always obtrusive) Plus-icon, other essential features are on the smaller ‚Ä¶-sign. Despite the beta periode, the V3 release was unstable, buggy and some essential features surrounding card management were broken. 

And while not entirely app related, more importantly: bunq showed its true colours. While asking for feedback, both during and after the beta period, nothing was done with it. It was dismissed as a small group of vocal users and not the silent majority of bunq users. By now, with barely a handful of positive reviews in an ocean of one star reviews, even bunq‚Äôs CEO must have learned that silent users don‚Äôt all have the same opinion. 

It got worse: Comments are removed from the (in-app) forum, users banned from it (and with that: also making it impossible for those users to create Common Goals, which is actually nice feature from Update 14). Concerns raised about the existence of non-essential 3rd party trackers are not fully answered too, despite bunq being very vocal about how privacy comes first. And dozens of users are complaining they‚Äôve completely lost control over their money and can‚Äôt even reach bunq. 

All in all, bunq has shown it to be a completely unreliable company. While the app can be fixed by removing the Instagram non-sense, cleaning up the UI and getting rid of the trackers, it will take a lot more to fix the company. So while bunq has a great feature set (now buried deep into the app, and burdened by instability), they‚Äôre not worth it anymore. I won‚Äôt advice anyone anymore to join bunq, to the contrary: I‚Äôd advise everyone to leave them as soon as you can. 

So, in two months time I‚Äôve switched bank again. Think my money is definitely safer with Triodos and ING. 

If you think issues have been solved by now (as of July/August), think again and check out their own Together forums to see how they are still messing up by accidental deductions or locking users out of their accounts.

- Er is een speciaal tabblad waar alle Instagram posts van bunq te zien zijn. Wie zoekt dit in een bank?
- Veel acties zijn nu verstopt achter een plus knop, waardoor er meer kliks nodig zijn om iets te doen.
- In je overzicht staat onnodige informatie over hoeveel geld en tijd je bespaard hebt met bunq, wat niet te verbergen is.
Wordt helemaal gek van die bomenzooi en alle spam. En wat een slechte app is het geworden h√®. Gelukkig alle account opgezegd. Zelfs de Rabobank is beter in gebruiksvriendelijkheid van hun app.

V3 looks like an absolute train wreck, and what happens when you completely disregard user-centred design and try to force your own (marketing) agenda on your users.

Exactly what you‚Äôd want from a banking app. This new versions leaves no trace of that, making the essential user stories you‚Äôd want to complete in a banking app extremely hard to accomplish. In terms of NPS this makes (at least me) go from a promotor to a strong detractor. Previously I would recommend bunq to anyone that would listen, now with this new app and the terrible, absolutely terrible communication of the pricing changes I would not recommend anyone to touch it with a 10 foot pole.

Bunq used to be the clearest way I could be in charge of my finances, clearly see my money and I couldn‚Äôt stop talking about how great it was to all my friends. Then came the V3 (or 14.0.0) update and everything I raved about and loved about Bunq is gone. I can‚Äôt find my finances anywhere, my accounts are clouded by tribes and causes and trees that frankly have nothing to do with how I bank. I don‚Äôt need an Instagram feed of all the up-sells bunq wants me to buy, and the once amazing customisations I could make on my account to help me stay organised are gone. It is clear bunq is now only looking to make a profit and doesn‚Äôt care about its core customer base who used to love the clean, easy to use bunq app. Now it takes me 5 steps to change which account is linked to which card, to find the accounts I‚Äôm looking for, getting support and even just navigating my profile. There wasn‚Äôt even a tutorial about where everything has moved. Really thinking about leaving bunq and spending my money on banking elsewhere. Please bring back the previous app. If I could give 0 stars, I would. To new users‚Äî stay away.

I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever been compelled to write a negative review before, but this just might be the worst UI/UX I‚Äôve ever seen. 

Unlike many of the other recent (negative) reviews, I can‚Äôt compare it with previous versions of the app. I was simply trying to be a new customer and sign up for an account with one of the new generation of mobile banks. But instead of even a passably professional banking experience, what I found was a bizarre gamification app focusing on tree planting and ‚Äútrophies‚Äù and asking for access to my contacts (!). If I hadn‚Äôt known it was (supposed to be) a banking app, I‚Äôd have thought I‚Äôd accidentally downloaded a new game from Apple Arcade. All of which made it nearly impossible to find or identify how to do the basic functions (which was banking, in case we forgot). 

Ultimately, after heroically wading through all the fluff, I couldn‚Äôt even figure out if I signed up correctly. Do I have a Bunq account now? Do I not? Who can tell? In the end, it doesn‚Äôt matter because I‚Äôm certainly not trusting my money to this thing and am deleting the app.

The sleek and highly useful interface is gone.
Now I have something cluttered with all sorts of meaningless stuff. Where are all my online cards? Why is just one displayed? What‚Äôs up with the map and all those graphs that don‚Äôt provide any worth for me.
Wow, just wow. This is abysmal UX. Please bring back the clean and useful interface. I‚Äôd hate to switch banks but this is absolutely broken.
Also... The three circles on the main screen take up a lot of space yet deliver useless ‚Äúinsight‚Äù. If I want to check how many trees were planted I could do this in some far away menu as I‚Äôm not doing that very often. The other two circles are entirely useless. Saved time and money as guesstimates? how is this a thing you put on the main view? Also the instagramesque ‚Äúwe‚Äù second menu... why? just... why?! I don‚Äôt see any use for it.

This is a full meltdown. Random charges with no warning or explanation appear disappear and the reappear. Accounts are being frozen. (Yes, they have people‚Äôs money and won‚Äôt release it. )Not to mention how incredibly difficult it would be to navigate even if it functioned properly.

Apple should seriously consider pulling it from the store. A visit to their customer feedback forum shows the nightmare. Hundreds of past from bug reports to bad UI complaints with no response from an obviously overwhelmed CS team. This is a bank app. What do you think the security looks like if the front end is such a disaster. I‚Äôm sure hackers are running amok. I‚Äôve no idea when I‚Äôll see my money. 

I genuinely have never seen anything like this.

This bank used to have one of the best user experiences there was available in the banking space, but with their new BunQ V3 update to their app, everything that could have gone wrong, has. Not only is the UI design aesthetic horrible, it‚Äôs actually just not usable.

There used to be logic to the order and structure to the app, but now it‚Äôs just a mess. Instead of having all my most essential banking features available, I am now permanently greeted with immediate access to their Blog feed, a count of how many trees I should have been planting by paying for more features and the primary action button right in the middle of the screen is for features you use irregularly.

Beyond the senseless UI updates, they‚Äôve managed to break so many UX best practices and have made the App a chore to use. My 200 year old local bank has a better App experience.

And never mind the random issues suddenly appearing with credit cards being deactivated at random times.

It is clear and transparently visible that this V3 was designed and championed by a delusional CEO who wants to forcefully push his vision unto his app users for his own Ego soothing.

But every single Designer, Engineer and Marketer at BunQ today should be ashamed of themselves for putting out such a horrible product and actively lying to customers and treating the feedback about this update with such little regard.

You all at BunQ have a responsibility when it comes to managing our finances. We pay you for that responsibility. Stop treating your customers like dirt. Stop deleting all the negative feedback about this update on your social media channels and your forums. Stop telling customers that they should change their feedback to be more constructive.

Start taking some actual responsibility, roll back to what worked, actually listen to user research, and face your mistakes.
